items.name: Type
entries: The Tainted lung dragon's type changes to aberration (Tainted).

items.name: Alignment
entries: The Tainted lung dragon's alignment changes to neutral evil.

items.name: Damage Resistance
entries: The Tainted lung dragon has resistance to acid, cold, and necrotic damage.

items.name: Condition Immunities
entries: The Tainted lung dragon is can't be charmed, frightened, paralyzed, or poisoned. It also can't suffer from exhaustion.

items.name: Taint Score
entries: The Tainted lung dragon's Taint score equals its CR divided by 3, rounded down.

items.name: Challenge
entries: The Tainted lung dragon's challenge rating increases by 1.

items.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Tainted lung dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

items.name: Bite
entries: The Tainted lung dragon's bite attack deals its usual damage and has any additional effects. In addition, a bitten creature must succeed a Constitution saving throw (save DC = 8 + the Tainted lung dragon's proficiency bonus + its Constitution modifier) or have its Taint score increased by 1.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dragon's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). The dragon can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or somatic components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dragon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The dragon is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Invisible in Water
entries: The dragon is {@condition invisible} while fully immersed in water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon uses its Tempestuous Roar. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +15 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage. If the target is a creature, it can't take reactions until the beginning of its next turn.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} +15 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tempestuous Roar
entries: Each creature of the dragon' choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success and taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) thunder damage on a failed save. If a creatures saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Tempestuous Roar for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Storm Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales lightning in a 10 feet wide, 120 feet long line. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 77 ({@damage 22d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice). In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom (perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Lung Jump (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon's physical form momentarily shifts into pure energy as it bursts forward with immense speed, moving 15 feet in a straight line or 60 feet if under water. Each creature in the dragon's path must succeed a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) force damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. If the dragon ends its lung jump in an occupied space, it takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) force damage and is pushed to the nearest unoccupied space.

monster.name: Werebadger

ac.condition: in honey badger and hybrid form

walk.condition: (40 ft. burrow 20 ft. in honey badger and hybrid form)

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

languages: Oriental (can't speak in honey badger form)

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the werebadger can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Frenzied Twist (Honey Badger and Hybrid Form Only)
entries: The werebadger has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The werebadger has advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the werebadger takes damage that reduces it to 0 hit points, unless the damage is from a critical hit, it drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The werebadger can use its action to polymorph into a Large honey badger-humanoid hybrid or into a Large honey badger, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: In honey badger form, the werebadger attacks once with its bite and two times with its claws. In humanoid form, the werebadger attacks four times with its nodachi. In hybrid form, it can attack like a honey badger or a humanoid.

action.name: Bite (Honey Badger or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the werebadger can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw (Honey Badger or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werebadger lycanthropy.

action.name: Nodachi (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

entries.name: Werebadger
entries: Werebadgers are exceptionally tough opponents. They are renowned for their aggression and often become the apex predator in their region.

In humanoid form they are tall, lean, and muscular, their hair always white. Regardless of their form, they always live in solitude. Only during the month of Nigiyaka, the last month of spring, might a werebadger seek company to breed or hunt in packs.

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the werefox can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The werefox can use its action to polymorph into a Medium fox-humanoid hybrid, into a Medium fox, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The werefox has advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: The werefox makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite.

action.name: Bite (Rat or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werefox lycanthropy.

action.name: Wakizahi (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shuriken (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range
20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

entries.name: Werefox
entries: Two types of werefox exist in the Orient: the red and the white werefox. Red werefoxes typically live in small family groups within or near forests. White werefoxes are solitary creatures that live in the mountains. No matter their color, they are omnivores, and far less aggressive than other lycanthropes.
In humanoid form they are almost gaunt to look at, standing straight, and walking with an elegance similar to that of elves.

monster.name: Werecrocodile

walk.condition: (swim 50 ft. in crocodile and hybrid form)

senses: darkvision 120 ft. (crocodile and hybrid form only)

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Ambush
entries: The werecrocodile has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The werecrocodile can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The werecrocodile can use its action to polymorph into a Large crocodile- humanoid hybrid or into a Huge crocodile, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Underwater Camouflage (Crocodile and Hybrid Form Only)
entries: The werecrocodile has advantage on Dexterity (stealth) checks made while underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: In crocodile form, the werecrocodile attacks once with its bite and once with its tail. In humanoid form, the werecrocodile attacks four times with its kamayari. In hybrid form, it can attack like a crocodile or a humanoid.

action.name: Bite (Crocodile or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the crocodile can't bite another target. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werecrocodile lycanthropy.

action.name: Tail (Crocodile or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Kamayari (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

entries.name: Werecrocodile
entries: Werecrocodiles live in small, isolated groups near bodies of water. They aren't particularly territorial, though they tend to stay in the same region throughout their lives.

The biggest male in a group is generally the leader, though females that can breed are venerated and always allowed to eat first when prey has been caught. In humanoid form they have slender bodies, yellow eyes, and their body temperature is slightly below that of other humanoids.

While they cannot talk in crocodile form, they are still very much capable of communicating simple messages through bellowing, chirping, and screeching. They are ambush predators, waiting for prey to come close before rushing out to attack.

walk.condition: (50 ft. in hybrid and rhinoceros form)

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Charge (Hybrid Form Only)
entries: If the wererhinoceros moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature right before hitting it with a gore attack, the target takes an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Impale (Rhino Form Only)
entries: If the wererhinoceros moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature right before hitting it with a gore attack, the target takes an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the rhino can't impale another target. The grapple ends early if the wererhinoceros changes into humanoid or hybrid form.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the wererhinoceros takes damage that reduces it to 0 hit points, unless the damage is from a critical hit, it drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The wererhinoceros can use its action to polymorph into a Large rhino- humanoid hybrid or into a Huge rhino, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: In humanoid form, the wererhino makes three attacks with its naginata. In hybrid form, the wererhinoceros makes two melee attacks, only one of which can be a gore attack.

action.name: Gore (Hybrid or Rhino Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage if used in hybrid form, or 18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage if used in rhino form. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wererhinoceros lycanthropy.

action.name: Naginata (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Slam (Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Wererhinoceros
entries: Wererhinoceroses live in tribes with the eldest male leading them. The males typically mark the group's territory by scraping their feet across the ground, breaking foliage, leaving pungent urine, and drawing their tribe's mark. They rarely wander far from their territory, and if others invade their territory, they will fight relentlessly even against unlikely odds.
In hybrid or rhinoceros form, their skin is exceptionally tough, making them very hard to kill. In humanoid form they are bulky and their noses are slightly above average size.

monster.name: Wereshark

walk.condition: (30 ft. swim 30 ft. in hybrid form and 0 ft. swim 50 ft. in shark form)

senses: blindsight 60 ft. (hybrid and shark form only)

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The wereshark has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness (Hybrid Form Only)
entries: The wereshark can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The wereshark can use its action to polymorph into a Large shark-humanoid hybrid or into a Huge shark, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Shark Telepathy (Shark Form Only)
entries: The wereshark can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

trait.name: Water Breathing (Shark Form Only)
entries: The wereshark can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: In hybrid form, the wereshark makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite. In humanoid form, the wereshark makes three attacks.

action.name: Bite (Hybrid or Shark Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage if used in hybrid form, or 21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage if used in shark form. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wereshark lycanthropy.

action.name: Kamayari (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Slam (Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Wereshark
entries: Weresharks value strength above all else. Though they live in groups, weresharks prefer to hunt in solitude. They have a very complex and dynamic social hierarchy where the females dominate the males, the stronger dominate the weaker, and everybody dominates newcomers. Dominance is rarely achieved through infighting, but rather through rituals and displays until one party bows to the other. Towards outsiders, however, dominance is usually established by biting, even if it isn't meant to kill which it often is.

They are most commonly found near the sea. While they might try and make others believe this is due to their fondness of salt water over fresh water, it is in fact because they fear the ocre, which occupies many inland bodies of water.
In humanoid form, they have bulky bodies, bald heads, and gray eyes.

trait.name: Acolyte's Recklessness
entries: If the acolyte is reduced to 0 hit points due to its own maho, roll a {@dice d20}. On a roll of 11 or higher, the acolyte instead drops to 1 hit point and gains another Action that can be used immediately.

trait.name: Maho
entries: The acolyte is a maho-tsukai. It's maho spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}, spell attack modifier +4). Whenever the acolyte casts a spell, all creatures within 5 ft. of it (including itself) take necrotic damage as noted next to the spell. The acolyte can use maho to cast the following spells, replacing material components with its own blood:

action.name: Tanto
entries: {@atk mw,rw} +2 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60, one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

Mahu-tsukai are blood mages, often operating in cells. The use of maho is outlawed, and as such all maho-tsukai operate in secrecy. Maho-tsukai learn their abilities from another maho-user, from an oni, or in rare cases through contact with unknown powers while dreaming.

entries.name: Blood Paths
entries: There are three distinct paths a maho-tsukai acolyte can follow: the path of the mage is the path that focuses the most on pure blood magic, while the path of the magus focuses on combining blood magic with martial prowess, and the path of the necromancer focuses on blood magic that manipulates the forces of life and death.

trait.name: Maho
entries: The mage is a maho-tsukai. It's maho spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, spell attack modifier +6). Whenever the mage casts a spell, all creatures within 5 ft. of it (including itself) take necrotic damage as noted next to the spell. The mage can use maho to cast the following spells, replacing material components with its own blood:

items: {@dice 1d6}: {@spell burning hands}, {@spell magic missile}, {@spell mage armor}
Special: {@spell blood of fire|HotO}, {@spell conjure lesser elemental vortex|MotO}, {@spell mark of doom|MotO}

trait.name: Maho Mastery
entries: If the mage casts a spell while it has a hostile creature within 5 feet of it, it may make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the mage takes no damage from the casting as it draws upon the vitality of nearby enemies. If it succeeds the saving throw by 5 or more, it regains a number of hit points equal to half the damage it would have taken on a failed save.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The mage regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Tanto
entries: {@atk mw,rw} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60, one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

Mahu-tsukai are blood mages, often operating in cells. The use of maho is outlawed, and as such all maho-tsukai operate in secrecy. Maho-tsukai learn their abilities from another maho-user, from an oni, or in rare cases through contact with unknown powers while dreaming.

entries.name: Blood Paths
entries: There are three distinct paths a maho-tsukai acolyte can follow: the path of the mage is the path that focuses the most on pure blood magic, while the path of the magus focuses on combining blood magic with martial prowess, and the path of the necromancer focuses on blood magic that manipulates the forces of life and death.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The magus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Maho
entries: The magus is a maho-tsukai. It's maho spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, spell attack modifier +9). Whenever the magus casts a spell, all creatures within 5 ft. of it (including itself) take necrotic damage as noted next to the spell. The magus can use maho to cast the following spells, replacing material components with its own blood:

items: {@dice 1d6}: {@spell burning hands}, {@spell magic missile}, {@spell mage armor}
Special: {@spell acidic veins|MotO}, {@spell conjure greater elemental vortex|MotO}, {@spell mark of doom|MotO}, {@spell red mist|MotO}

trait.name: Maho Mastery
entries: If the mage casts a spell while it has a hostile creature within 5 feet of it, it may make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the mage takes no damage from the casting as it draws upon the vitality of nearby enemies. If it succeeds the saving throw by 5 or more, it regains a number of hit points equal to half the damage it would have taken on a failed save

trait.name: Magical Attacks
entries: The magus' weapon attacks are magical and include the magus' Intelligence modifier for attack and damage rolls (included in the attack).

trait.name: Necrotic Strikes
entries: When the magus hits with his ninja-to, the weapon deals an additional {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage (included in the attack). The magus regains hit point equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The magus regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The magus makes four attacks with his ninja-to.

action.name: Ninja-to
entries: {@atk mw} +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing or slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

Mahu-tsukai are blood mages, often operating in cells. The use of maho is outlawed, and as such all maho-tsukai operate in secrecy. Maho-tsukai learn their abilities from another maho-user, from an oni, or in rare cases through contact with unknown powers while dreaming.

entries.name: Blood Paths
entries: There are three distinct paths a maho-tsukai acolyte can follow: the path of the mage is the path that focuses the most on pure blood magic, while the path of the magus focuses on combining blood magic with martial prowess, and the path of the necromancer focuses on blood magic that manipulates the forces of life and death.

trait.name: Grim Harvest (1/Turn)
entries: When the necromancer kills a creature that is neither a construct nor undead with a spell of 1st level or higher, the necromancer regains hit points equal to twice the spell's cost, or three times if its a necromancy spell.

trait.name: Maho
entries: The necromancer is a maho-tsukai. It's maho spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, spell attack modifier +6). Whenever the necromancer casts a spell, all creatures within 5 ft. of it (including itself) take necrotic damage as noted next to the spell. The necromancer can use maho to cast the following spells, replacing material components with its own blood:

items: {@dice 2d6}: {@spell blindness/deafness}, {@spell mirror image}, {@spell ray of enfeeblement}
{@dice 3d6}: {@spell animate dead}, {@spell bestow curse}, {@spell vampiric touch}
Special: {@spell blood of fire|HotO}, {@spell conjure lesser elemental vortex|MotO}, {@spell mark of doom|MotO}, {@spell red mist|MotO}

trait.name: Maho Mastery
entries: If the mage casts a spell while it has a hostile creature within 5 feet of it, it may make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the mage takes no damage from the casting as it draws upon the vitality of nearby enemies.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The necromancer regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the necromancer takes psychic or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the necromancer's next turn. The necromancer dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Tanto
entries: {@atk mw,rw} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60, one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

Mahu-tsukai are blood mages, often operating in cells. The use of maho is outlawed, and as such all maho-tsukai operate in secrecy. Maho-tsukai learn their abilities from another maho-user, from an oni, or in rare cases through contact with unknown powers while dreaming.

entries.name: Blood Paths
entries: There are three distinct paths a maho-tsukai acolyte can follow: the path of the mage is the path that focuses the most on pure blood magic, while the path of the magus focuses on combining blood magic with martial prowess, and the path of the necromancer focuses on blood magic that manipulates the forces of life and death.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The jian can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when he is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: Unless the jian is possessing a creature, it can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the jian fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Light from Beyond
entries: As a bonus action, the jian can begin emitting a bright, white light from its spectral body or the eyes and mouth of the creature it is possessing. When a creature that can see the jian starts its turn within 30 feet of the jian, the jian can force it to make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw if the jian isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save is {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the jian until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the jian in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Maho
entries: The jian is a maho-tsukai. Its maho spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 20}, spell attack modifier +12). The jian can only cast spells when it has possessed a creature that has blood. Whenever The jian casts a spell, all creatures within 5 ft. of it (including itself) take necrotic damage as noted next to the spell. The jian can use maho to cast the following spells, replacing material components with his own blood:

items: 1: {@spell chill touch}, {@spell fire bolt}, {@spell invisibility}, {@spell mage hand}, {@spell ray of frost}
{@dice 1d6}: {@spell burning hands}, {@spell magic missile}, {@spell mage armor}, {@spell shield}
{@dice 2d6}: {@spell detect thoughts}, {@spell invisibility}, {@spell mirror image}, {@spell misty step}
{@dice 3d6}: {@spell animate dead}, {@spell counterspell}, {@spell dispel magic}, {@spell fireball}, {@spell fly}
{@dice 4d6}: {@spell blight}, {@spell dimension door}, {@spell greater invisibility}, {@spell wall of fire}
{@dice 6d6}: {@spell chain lightning}, {@spell disintegrate}, {@spell globe of invulnerability}, {@spell mass suggestion}
{@dice 7d6}: {@spell finger of death}, {@spell plane shift}, {@spell teleport}
{@dice 8d6}: {@spell earthquake}, {@spell incendiary cloud}, {@spell power word stun}
Special: {@spell acidic veins|MotO}, {@spell conjure greater elemental vortex|MotO}, {@spell mark of doom|MotO}, {@spell red mist|MotO}

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The jian has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Spectral Defense
entries: Unless The jian is possessing a creature, its AC includes its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma modifiers.

action.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries: {@atk mw} +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The jian enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

action.name: Possession {@recharge}
entries: One humanoid that the jian can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the jian; the jian then disappears, and the target is {@condition incapacitated} and loses control of its body. The jian now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The jian can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, saving throw bonuses, truesight, and immunity to being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, and {@condition frightened}. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.
Whenever the possessed creature takes damage, the jian's hit point maximum is reduced by half that amount for 24 hours.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the jian ends it as a bonus action, or the jian is turned or forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the jian reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to the jian's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

action.name: Eternal Prison (1/Day)
entries: The jian targets one creature that it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed a {@dc 20} Charisma saving throw or be magically trapped inside a pocket plane filled with magical darkness. lf the jian drops to 0 hit points, it is destroyed and all creatures trapped within its pocket plane reappear in unoccupied spaces nearest to spot at which the jian died.

A creature trapped in this manner doesn't age and doesn't require food or drink, but must roll on the Indefinite Madness table in the Dungeon Master's Guide for each minute imprisoned, as time passes a thousand times faster within the pocket plane.

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: The jian casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Paralyzing Touch (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The jian uses its Paralyzing Touch.

legendary.name: Life Drain (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Each living creature within 20 feet of The jian must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw against this magic, or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage, and the jian regains hit points equal to the total damage dealt to all targets.

A maho-tsukai jian is a maho-tsukai that has achieved immortality through undeath by sacrificing its mortal body. The path to becoming jian—a "ghost of a ghost"—is a well-guarded secret and something that most, if not all, maho-tsukai aspire towards.
A jian is a spectral horror, capable of possessing living humanoids to fuel its maho in which it is unmatched, though it is still a terrifying opponent in its spectral form.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A maho-tsukai jian doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Martial Elemental Spirits
entries: A maho-tsukai jian possesses the ability to perform the dreaded Ritual of Elemental Blood-Binding. The ritual requires a willing humanoid who is completely drained of blood, allowing the jian to bind an elemental spirit within the lifeless body. The elemental spirit, now bound within a humanoid body, is completely devoted to the jian that performed the ritual. There is no physical evidence of its presence within the body.
When the ritual is performed, the jian can call upon one of three possible elemental spirits, and a jian usually doesn't have more than one of each in its service at any given time.

entries.name: {@creature Martial Spirit of Lightning|MotO}
entries: This spirit seeks to kill as often as possible. It wields the power of electricity, capable of propelling itself as bolt of lightning to quickly reach its foes, striking them with its crackling katana that stops them in their tracks.

entries.name: {@creature Martial Spirit of Rain|MotO}
entries: This spirit is vicious and revels in the suffering of others. It is quick and cunning, wielding the power of water and ice and even capable of controlling the weather.

entries.name: {@creature Martial Spirit of Thunder|MotO}
entries: This spirit seeks to destroy anything and everything both lives and objects in equal measure. It is quick to anger and it attacks in brutal displays of immense strength and unstoppable violence.

entries.name: Elemental Nature
entries: An elemental spirit doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: A Maho-Tsukai's Lair
entries: A maho-tsukai jian most often makes its lair within a tomb. Maho-tsukai come from every corner of the land to pay tribute to the jian within its unholy abode. The challenge rating of a maho-tsukai jian is 24 (62,000 XP) if encountered in its lair.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The spirit's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The spirit can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or verbal components:

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the spirit dies, it explodes, and each creature within 20 feet of it must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Flurry of Blows
entries: Using a bonus action, the spirit can make two unarmed strikes.

trait.name: Lightning Strike (1/Turn)
entries: The spirit can turn into pure electricity and teleport up to 60 feet before returning to its regular form. The next crackling katana attack it makes on the same turn is made with advantage and deals an additional 21 ({@damage 6d6}) lightning damage.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the spirit is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Weapon Bond
entries: The spirit can summon its weapon into its hand using a bonus action. The spirit can't be disarmed of its weapon unless {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Crackling Katana
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage. If the target is a creature, it must make a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and rolls a {@dice d8} to determine what it does during that turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action but uses all its movement to move in a random direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes one melee attack against a random creature, or it does nothing if no creature is within reach.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) lightning damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The spirit's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The spirit can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or verbal components:

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the spirit dies, it explodes, and each creature within 20 feet of it must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the spirit can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Rainy Weather
entries: While outside, the spirit can use an action to conjure forth clouds that bring rain in a 5-mile area centered on itself. The temperature becomes cool and any natural winds disappear.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the spirit is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, his AC includes his Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Weapon Bond
entries: The spirit can summon its weapon into its hand using a bonus action. The spirit can't be disarmed of its weapon unless {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spirit makes three attacks in any combination.

action.name: Cold Sweep
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., all targets. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Freezing Ninja-to
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing or slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage. If the target is a creature, the spirit can choose one of the following additional effects:

items: The target must succeed a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, or lose the ability to make opportunity attacks until the beginning of its next turn.
The target must succeed a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, or have its speed halved until the beginning of the spirit's next turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The spirit's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The spirit can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or verbal components:

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the spirit dies, it explodes, and each creature within 20 feet of it must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Feral Instinct
entries: The spirit cannot be surprised and has advantage on initiative rolls.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the spirit can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the spirit takes 20 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Weapon Bond
entries: The spirit can summon its weapon into its hand using a bonus action. The spirit can't be disarmed of its weapon unless {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the spirit is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Thunder makes two attacks with his booming nodachi or thunderous hankyu.

action.name: Booming Nodachi
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) thunder damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet back and knocked {@condition prone}. If the spirit scores a critical hit, it rolls damage dice three times, instead of twice. Each hit rings with thunder that is audible within 300 feet.

action.name: Thunderous Hankyu
entries: {@atk rw} +6 to hit, range (80/320), one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) thunder damage.

reaction.name: Deflection
entries: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, the spirit deflects the missile. The damage it takes from the attack is reduced by {@dice 2d10 + 2}. If the damage is reduced to 0, the spirit catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and the spirit has a hand free. If it catches the missile, it can hurl it back at the attacker as part of the same reaction.

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the obake dies, its hive shatters and creatures within 30 feet of it must succeed a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become confused. A confused creature cannot take reactions and must roll a {@dice d10} at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn:

rows: The creature uses all its movement to move in a random direction. To determine the direction, roll a {@dice d8} and assign a direction to each die face. The creature doesn't take an action this turn.
The creature doesn't move or take actions this turn.
The creature uses its action to make a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach. If there is no creature within its reach, the creature does nothing this turn.
The creature can act and move normally.

entries: At the end of each of its turns, an affected target can make a Wisdom saving throw. If it succeeds, this effect ends for that target.

trait.name: Cape of Wasps
entries: As a bonus action on its turn, the obake can release or withdraw a cloud of wasps. The wasps fill the obake's space, granting it three-quarters cover. A creature that touches the obake or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it while the cloud is up, takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The obake has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Otherworldly Awareness
entries: The obake knows the exact location of any creature within 60 feet of it, as long as they aren't fully submerged in water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The obake uses its Releases Swarm twice and its Release Plague once.

action.name: Release Plague
entries: Swarming, stinging wasps fill a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of the obake's choice within 300 feet of it that it can see. The sphere spreads around corners. The sphere remains for 1 minute, and its area is lightly obscured. The sphere's area is difficult terrain. When the area appears, each creature in it apart must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d10} piercing damage plus {@damage 2d10} poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The obake itself and its released swarms are not affected by the plague. Two plagues can overlap, but then count as a single, larger plague.

action.name: Release Swarm
entries: The obake releases a swarm of wasps (variant swarm of insects) into a space within 10 feet of it. The swarm acts at the end of the obake's turns. While the obake is alive, it telepathically controls the swarm's actions. If the obake dies, the swarm is angered and relentlessly attacks the obake's slayers. The swarm is immune to the obake's Death Throes trait.

action.name: Teleport
entries: The obake magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

An obake appears as a kindly, elderly man or woman, seemingly carrying a large wicker basket. In truth, however, the obake is a cursed creature of otherworldly origin, carrying a massive wasp hive on its back. Within its hive live hundreds of thousands of wasps, each of which the obake can command for a wide range of different tasks.

entries.name: Live to Kill
entries: An obake murders for murder's sake, more than capable of laying waste to entire villages, only stopping when its own life is cut short. However, even in death, an obake is a harbinger of chaos and destruction.

entries.name: Otherworldly Nature
entries: An obake doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Underwater Camouflage
entries: The ocre has advantage on Dexterity (stealth) checks made while underwater.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The ocre can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ocre makes two melee attacks, only one of which can be an inject attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the ocre cannot bite another target.

action.name: Inject
entries: {@atk mw} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature the ocre has {@condition grappled}. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage. The target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw against curses. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to crystalline salt and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} until freed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or other magic.

The ocre is a large, monstrous beast that lives in lakes and rivers. It doesn't feed on flesh, but rather injects a cursed liquid into its prey which slowly turns the creature into crystalline salt the ocre then feeds on the salt by licking it until nothing is left.

entries.name: Territorial Predators
entries: The ocre resembles a spotted mosasaurus with a slightly shorter body and larger fangs. They are highly territorial creatures, though they rarely kill their own kind. Instead, they fight over territory with the loser giving away parts of his to the victor. If an ocre's territory ever becomes so small that it cannot reliably catch prey, it becomes depressed, and jumps onto land to die.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The oni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). The oni can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material, or verbal components:

trait.name: Burning Tongues
entries: The oni can have up to three tongues at a time. Each tongue can be attacked (AC 10; 10 hit points; resistance to acid, cold, fire, and necrotic damage; immunity to poison and psychic damage, and bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons). Destroying a tongue deals no damage to the oni, which regrows lost tongues at the end of its next turn. A tongue can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a {@dc 19} Strength check against it. A creature that touches the tongue or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The oni has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The oni's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The oni regenerates 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The oni deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The oni can use its Frightful Presence. It then attacks with any number of tongues it has available, followed by two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 4d12 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tongue (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 90 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. A creature that is {@condition grappled} at the start of its turn, takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage.

action.name: Blastwave {@recharge 5}
entries: The oni releases a blastwave in all directions. Each creature in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on the oni must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage and 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The blaswave ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried and plant life in the area dies.

action.name: Frightful Presence (Oni Form Only)
entries: Each creature of the oni's choice that is within 60 feet of the oni and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the oni's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The oni magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Other than its size, its statistics are the same in each form. If the oni dies, it reverts to its true form.

Oni are the most fearsome denizens of the Shadowlands, fiends of unmitigated evil and terror. Oni come in apparently limitless varieties, though they all have one thing in common: their unholy existence originates deep within the bowels of Jigoku through some horrible will.

entries.name: Tainted Nature
entries: An oni doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Akuma Spawn
entries: These massive oni resemble bipedal and horned chameleons with red scales and razor sharp claws. An akuma spawn is truly a menacing sight for even the bravest of warriors. Behind its massive teeth it has three tongues, all ignited with an unholy fire. Amaranthine in color, it looks like a tail-less miniature version of its dark creator: Akuma the Incinerator, Oni Lord of Fire and Hatred.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The oni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 10}). The oni can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material, or verbal components:

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The oni is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The oni has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The oni regenerates 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The oni makes two attacks with its vicious claws. If it lands a critical hit with a vicious claw attack, it can make a gore attack against the same target as a bonus

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Vicious Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. This attack lands as a critical hit on a roll of 19 and 20.

Oni are the most fearsome denizens of the Shadowlands, fiends of unmitigated evil and terror. Oni come in apparently limitless varieties, though they all have one thing in common: their unholy existence originates deep within the bowels of Jigoku through some horrible will.

entries.name: Tainted Nature
entries: An oni doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Arugai no Oni
entries: An arugai no oni, also called a vicious slicer, is a small but aggressive and extremely territorial oni. They resemble small, hulking humanoids, with long fin-like and sharp horns and equally long and sharp claws. Their plate-like skin is gray on the front and purple on the back.

entries.name: Relentless Killers
entries: They are not very intelligent, but whatever they encounter they fight until death, even if they encounter one of their own. They are formed from Jigoku itself, having seemingly no purpose other than to guard their territory against any and all intruders.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The oni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). The oni can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material, or verbal components:

trait.name: Barbed Carapace (Oni Form Only)
entries: A creature that touches the oni or hits it with a melee attack while with in 5 feet of it takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Chameleon Carapace (Oni Form Only)
entries: The oni can change the color of its carapace to match the color and texture of its surroundings. As a result, it has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Limited Spines
entries: The oni has seven tentacle spines. Used spines regrow by the time the oni finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Reflective Carapace (Oni Form Only)
entries: Any time the oni is targeted by a magic missile spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 4 or 5, the oni is unaffected. On a 6, the oni is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the oni, turning the caster into the target.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The oni regenerates 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the oni surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 21 ({@damage 6d6}) damage from the attack.

trait.name: Tainted Attacks
entries: The oni's attacks are filled with Taint. Once per round, if a creature suffers damage from the oni's acid spray, bite, tentacles, or tentacle spines, it must succeed a DC14 Constitution saving throw or have its Taint score increased by 1.

action.name: Multiattack (Oni Form Only)
entries: The oni makes one attack with its bite and two attacks with its tentacles, or it shoots twice with its tentacle spines.

action.name: Acid Spray (Oni Form Only, Recharge 5-6)
entries: The oni spits acid in a line that is 30 feet long and 10 feet wide, provided that it has no creature {@condition grappled}. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Bite (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the oni can bite only the {@condition grappled} creature and has advantage on attack rolls to do so.

action.name: Tentacle (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tentacle Spine (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The oni magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Other than its size, its statistics are the same in each form. If the oni dies, it reverts to its true form.

Oni are the most fearsome denizens of the Shadowlands, fiends of unmitigated evil and terror. Oni come in apparently limitless varieties, though they all have one thing in common: their unholy existence originates deep within the bowels of Jigoku through some horrible will.

entries.name: Tainted Nature
entries: An oni doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Ashi no Oni
entries: An ashi no oni is a worm-like creature with seven thorn-studded tentacles sprouting from its body. Thorny plates protect its body, and its head is adorned with more horns and barbs. Its face is eerily human-like, with deep-set black eyes and a gaping mouth lined with sharp fangs. The oni's body is about 15 feet long, and weighs about 2,000 pounds. It typically emerges only about halfway from the earth when attacking, preferring not to move around above ground. It is commonly referred to as a "barbed lurker".

entries.name: Menace Beneath the Sands
entries: Ashi no oni are solitary and territorial creatures, found in the deserts and canyons of the Shadowlands, lurking in caves or hidden under the shifting sands. They have barbs running down the length of their spines, resembling sharp rocks when they lie waiting in the ground. They are highly intelligent and use all available means to put their prey in a disadvantageous position.

Ashi no oni are among the most feared oni, as their carapace provides them with ample protection against physical and magical attacks. It is said that you need at least seven people to combat an ashi no oni; one for each of its tentacles.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The oni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). The oni can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material, or verbal components:

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the oni dies, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 49 ({@damage 14d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures within 5 feet of the oni have disadvantage on the saving throw.

trait.name: Pestilent
entries: A creature that touches the oni or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage.

trait.name: Pestilent Fumes (Oni Form Only)
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the oni must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be infected by Soul Rot. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the oni's pestilent fumes for 24 hours.

trait.name: Inscrutable
entries: The oni is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the oni's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The oni has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The oni's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The oni regenerates 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The oni can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes two attacks with its claws and one with its pseudopod.

action.name: Claw (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Frightful Presence (Oni Form Only)
entries: Each creature of the oni's choice that is within 60 feet of the oni and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the oni's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The oni magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Other than its size, its statistics are the same in each form. If the oni dies, it reverts to its true form.

Oni are the most fearsome denizens of the Shadowlands, fiends of unmitigated evil and terror. Oni come in apparently limitless varieties, though they all have one thing in common: their unholy existence originates deep within the bowels of Jigoku through some horrible will.

entries.name: Tainted Nature
entries: An oni doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Byoki Spawn
entries: Just as their dark mother, these pestilent horrors are capable of spreading a dark and unholy disease, capable of wreaking havoc long after the oni has been slain.

entries.name: Creatures of Pestilence
entries: Byoki spawns are humanoid bones that are animated by Byoki's dark will. Given life through disease and pestilence, they glow a dark purple from within their corrosive core, which they can use to shape pseudopods. They lack legs, but instead hover across the ground with hateful determination. Their names are engraved in Oni on their foreheads, and while they may be confused if another speaks their name, they follow only Byoki, for they are made from her very essence.

headerEntries: The oni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). The oni can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material, or verbal components:

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The oni regenerates 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack (Oni Form Only)
entries: The oni makes two attacks with its claws or ninja-to. If it is grappling a creature, it can also make an attack with its tongue as a bonus action.

action.name: Claw (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}).

action.name: Ninja-to
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing or piercing damage.

action.name: Tongue (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 30 ft., one creature {@condition grappled} by the oni or an {@condition unconscious} creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) acid damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target fails its saving throw, the oni regains hit points equal to the damage done.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The oni magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Other than its size, its statistics are the same in each form. If the oni dies, it reverts to its true form.

Oni are the most fearsome denizens of the Shadowlands, fiends of unmitigated evil and terror. Oni come in apparently limitless varieties, though they all have one thing in common: their unholy existence originates deep within the bowels of Jigoku through some horrible will.

entries.name: Tainted Nature
entries: An oni doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Haino no Oni
entries: In stark contrast to the gibbering hordes that make up most armies of the Shadowlands, the haino no oni is a quiet and stealthy, albeit hungry, oni. Cloaked in human form, haino no oni snake their incredibly long tongues into inns and homes, inserting them down sleeping victims' throats to feed on them. They are most commonly found within the Empire itself, rather than in the Shadowlands as they excel at remaining undetected. They are commonly referred to as drainers.

entries.name: Hidden Horror
entries: In their natural form, haino no oni resemble a cancerous, skinless, and toad-like humanoid. They stand about 5 feet tall and weigh roughly 120 pounds. They are almost never found in this form, however, preferring a human guise that still allows them the use of their long, tube-like tongues.

monster.name: Kamu no Oni (Dreadmaw)
languages: understands Oni and Oriental (common) but doesn't speak

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the oni moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a slam attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 22 ({@damage 4d10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The oni has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The oni regenerates 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The oni deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack (Oni Form Only)
entries: The oni makes three slam attacks or fires two magma bolts.

action.name: Slam (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}) if it is a Large or smaller creature and the oni doesn't have two other creatures {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Magma Bolt (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Consume (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature {@condition grappled} by the oni or a creature at 0 hit points. {@h}The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be consumed and die, as its body is obliterated in molten rock. If the target is at 0 hit points, it fails its saving throw automatically. If the target is consumed, the oni regains 39 ({@dice 6d12}) hit points.

action.name: Haste {@recharge 5}
entries: Until the end of its next turn, the oni magically gains a +2 bonus to its AC, has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, has its movement speed doubled, and can use its slam attack as a bonus action.

action.name: Frightful Presence (Oni Form Only)
entries: Each creature of the oni's choice that is within 60 feet of the oni and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the oni's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The oni magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Other than its size, its statistics are the same in each form. If the oni dies, it reverts to its true form.

Oni are the most fearsome denizens of the Shadowlands, fiends of unmitigated evil and terror. Oni come in apparently limitless varieties, though they all have one thing in common: their unholy existence originates deep within the bowels of Jigoku through some horrible will.

entries.name: Tainted Nature
entries: An oni doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Kamu no Oni
entries: Ravenous creatures that form the bulk of many Shadowlands hordes, kamu no oni are dreaded by all for their tendency to dismember and consume fallen foes before moving forward to attack new enemies. They have powerfully muscled and hulkish bodies, immensely sharp claws, a tail, and maybe most noticeably a dreadful and glowing mouth full of molten hot rock which it can spit at its foes. Kamu no oni are commonly referred to as dreadmaw.

entries.name: Perfect Soldiers
entries: They stand at least 11 feet tall and weigh about 3,000 pounds. Kamu no oni are stupid and brutish, but follow orders well, particularly when the orders amount to "Kill them all." They can become impossibly fast for short bursts, enabling them to close distances fast, and making them the perfect vanguard in an oni army.

The target must succeed a DC19 Charisma saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn. If a creature dies from this attack, the oni is reinvigorated and regains lost hit points equal to the damage done.

action.name: Kyoso's Curse {@recharge}
entries: The oni targets up to two creatures it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become cursed. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on a success. If a target dies while cursed, the oni regains a number of hit points equal to the creatures hit point maximum..

If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the oni's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Tainted Nature
entries: An oni doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Kyoso Spawn
entries: These crimson, serpentine oni have the upper torso of a female humanoid, with four clawed arms, two fleshy wings, and a sinister cobra-like hood. They hunt in packs only when directed by their dark matron, otherwise preferring to hunt in solitude. They can burrow through the ground, surfacing to catch their prey unaware, but are more adept in the air or submerged.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The oni magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Other than its size, its statistics are the same in each form. If the oni dies, it reverts to its true form.

Oni are the most fearsome denizens of the Shadowlands, fiends of unmitigated evil and terror. Oni come in apparently limitless varieties, though they all have one thing in common: their unholy existence originates deep within the bowels of Jigoku through some horrible will.

entries.name: Tainted Nature
entries: An oni doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Nosloc no Oni
entries: The nosloc are numerous beyond counting, which is why they make up the bulk of mosts Shadowlands armies. They are naturally inclined to follow stronger oni, making them very easy to recruit. This behavior has given them the nickname of vassal oni.

entries.name: Skilled Soldiers
entries: Despite their follower mentality, however, they are adept warriors capable of fighting rank and file like even the most disciplined Clan armies. They are humanoid in shape, have muscled bodies, deep yellow eyes, and small horns protruding from their foreheads.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The oni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). The oni can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material, or verbal components:

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The oni doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The oni ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The oni has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The oni has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the oni's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The oni can take one reaction on every turn in a combat.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The oni regenerates 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack (Oni Form Only)
entries: The oni makes six wakizashi attacks and two attacks with its talons.

action.name: Talon (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Wakizashi
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dreadful Glare (Oni Form Only)
entries: The oni targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the oni, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the oni's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all sanru no oni for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The oni magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Other than its size, its statistics are the same in each form. If the oni dies, it reverts to its true form. The only equipment that is transformed are four of its wakizashis, which disappear while it doesn't have enough hands to hold them. If the oni dies, it reverts to its true form, and its wakizashis reappear.

Oni are the most fearsome denizens of the Shadowlands, fiends of unmitigated evil and terror. Oni come in apparently limitless varieties, though they all have one thing in common: their unholy existence originates deep within the bowels of Jigoku through some horrible will.

entries.name: Tainted Nature
entries: An oni doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Sanru no Oni
entries: Bearing a passing resemblance to metallic wolves, sanru no oni are six-armed, batwinged fiends that feast on rotting flesh. A sanru no oni has a humanoid-looking body, but its torso is unusually long to accommodate its extra arms. The glow of Taint and corruption escapes between its metallic openings. All six of its hands and its two feet are clawed, perfect for tearing its prey apart. Large, ungainly wings hang on its back. The oni stands about 7 feet tall, has a wingspan of roughly 15 feet, and weighs 250 pounds on average.

entries.name: Honorless Tactics
entries: The skyclaws, as they are commonly called, scour the Shadowlands iin groups of two or three, and rarely more than four.They rely on surprise attacks and utilize hit-and-run tactics. They might seem like birds from afar, but their grotesque physique quickly becomes obvious.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The oni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). The oni can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material, or verbal components:

trait.name: Ethereal Escape
entries: If reduced to 0 hit points, the oni's spirit immediately leaves his body in ethereal form. On his following turn, The oni's spirit can then inhabit a nearby Small or Medium humanoid corpse by using an action, animating it and slowly transforming it into a replica of the oni's original form. The transformation takes {@dice 2d4 - 1} rounds, but the oni is fully capable of continuing battle in its new body, with all its hit points fully restored. When the transformation is complete, it is once again a Small creature regarding of the corpse's size. The oni can only remain in spirit form for 1 minute. It can move ethereally during that time, but cannot pass through jade. If the oni cannot enter a corpse during that time, it is destroyed. The oni's spirit cannot be forced out of a body through magical means, and once his spirit has taken hold and the body is once again destroyed, only a wish spell can bring the deceased back to life.

trait.name: Inscrutable
entries: The oni is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the oni's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The oni has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The oni regenerates 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the oni is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Unnerving Aura (Oni Form Only)
entries: Each creature of the oni's choice that is within 20 feet of the oni and aware of it has disadvantage on concentration checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The oni casts a spell and makes two attacks with its Taint Blast.

action.name: Taint Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 120/240 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) force damage. If the target is a creature, it is pushed back 10 feet.

action.name: Taint Cloud {@recharge}
entries: The oni calls forth raw Taint in the form of a cold, cloying cloud of greasy darkness at a point it can see within 120 feet of it. The cloud has the shape of a sphere with a 20-foot radius and spreads around corners. Each creature within the cloud becomes {@condition blinded} while within the cloud and must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw the first time they enter the cloud during their turn, or if they start their turn within the cloud. A creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage, 14 ({@damage 4d6}) cold damage, and 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage, lands {@condition prone}, and gains +1 to its Taint score on a failed save. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage, doesn't land {@condition prone}, and doesn't have its Taint score increased. If a creature casts a spell while within the cloud, the creature must roll on the Wild Magic Surge table. The cloud lasts for 5 rounds before dissipating.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The oni magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Other than its size, its statistics are the same in each form. If the oni dies, it reverts to its true form.

Oni are the most fearsome denizens of the Shadowlands, fiends of unmitigated evil and terror. Oni come in apparently limitless varieties, though they all have one thing in common: their unholy existence originates deep within the bowels of Jigoku through some horrible will.

entries.name: Tainted Nature
entries: An oni doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Shikuba Spawn
entries: When the Oni Lord of Corruption and Deceit, Shikibu the Corrupter, takes a life, he can twist and mold a creature's soul into a parasitic spirit a shikibu spawn. They are without form, and can only obtain a physical body by entering the corpse of a deceased humanoid. Even after being possessed by the oni, the corpse looks exactly how it looked when the spirit entered the body the only thing that is different, is the corpse's eyes, which turn completely white.
