However, a shikibu spawn's spirit tears at the body, gradually blackening it, and within about a week the corpse is a burned out husk, unsuited to sustain the spirit any longer, forcing the shikibu spawn to find a new corpse. They are nigh impossible to kill as long as there are corpses nearby, as they cannot be truly destroyed while they have bodies to inhabit.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The oni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). The oni can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material, or verbal components:

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the oni can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Inscrutable
entries: The oni is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the oni's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The oni has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The oni's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The oni regenerates 30 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The oni deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Spell School Immunity
entries: The oni is completely immune to a random school of magic, ignoring all spells form that school. Roll a {@dice d8} to determine the school: 1 for abjuration, 2 for conjuration, 3 for divination, 4 for enchantment, 5 for evocation, 6 for illusion, 7 for necromancy, and 8 for transmutation.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The oni can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes four claw attacks.

action.name: Claw (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d8 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence (Oni Form Only)
entries: Each creature of the oni's choice that is within 60 feet of the oni and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the oni's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The oni magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Other than its size, its statistics are the same in each form. If the oni dies, it reverts to its true form.

Oni are the most fearsome denizens of the Shadowlands, fiends of unmitigated evil and terror. Oni come in apparently limitless varieties, though they all have one thing in common: their unholy existence originates deep within the bowels of Jigoku through some horrible will.

entries.name: Tainted Nature
entries: An oni doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Ugulu no Oni
entries: This bestial oni, commonly called doomhulk, is massive in size and attacks with brutal determination with its four clawed arms and its ferocious bite.

entries.name: Spell School Immunity
entries: The doomhulk has the remarkable and unique ability to completely ignore a single school of magic; this is an ability each amaranthian is created with. One might be immune to the school of evocation, completely ignoring any damage from a fireball, while another might be immune to the school of illusion, seeing through all illusions without having to pass any checks. This isn't a widely known fact, however, as those that stumble upon a doomhulk rarely live to tell the tale. They are unruly and can only be kept in check by an Oni Lord.

entries.name: Brutes
entries: Doomhulks are ferocious brutes, both impossibly strong and exceptionally fast as they massacre their way through countless opponents. Its tough skin protects it from all but the most skilled of warriors, and it can suffer almost innumerable wounds before it is brought down.

monster.name: Yattoko no Oni (Reaving Mantis)
languages: understands Oni and Oriental (common) but doesn't speak

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The oni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). The oni can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material, or verbal components:

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The oni ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The oni has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The oni's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The oni regenerates 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The oni deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The oni can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 5-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The oni can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes seven attacks: six with its barbed pincers and one bite attack.

action.name: Barbed Pincer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) piercing damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature and the oni doesn't have six other creatures {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d8 + 10}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature that is {@condition grappled} by the oni, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the oni, and it takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the oni's turns.

If the oni takes 40 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the oni must succeed on a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the oni. If the oni dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Frightful Presence (Oni Form Only)
entries: Each creature of the oni's choice that is within 60 feet of the oni and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the oni's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

Oni are the most fearsome denizens of the Shadowlands, fiends of unmitigated evil and terror. Oni come in apparently limitless varieties, though they all have one thing in common: their unholy existence originates deep within the bowels of Jigoku through some horrible will.

entries.name: Tainted Nature
entries: An oni doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Yattoko no Oni
entries: This massive oni resembles a gigantic mantis, with chitinous flesh and bulbous eyes protruding from its insect-like head. It feels neither pain nor compassion, and it attacks with a dark determination to kill anything smaller than itself, unless it is forced into the service of a stronger oni.

entries.name: Death From Below
entries: They are greatly feared because they burst forth through the ground, grabbing multiple opponents within the blink of an eye, before it swallows them and starts to digest them alive.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Akuma's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}). Akuma can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material, or verbal components:

trait.name: Burning Taint Aura (Oni Form Only)
entries: At the start of each of Akuma's turns, each creature within 10 feet of him takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage and catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature that touches Akuma or hits him with a melee attack while within 5 feet of him takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage.

trait.name: Burning Tongues
entries: Akuma can have up to three tongues at a time. Each tongue can be attacked (AC 10; 20 hit points; resistance to acid, cold, fire, and necrotic damage; immunity to poison and psychic damage, and bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons). Destroying a tongue deals no damage to Akuma, who regrows lost tongues at the end of his next turn. A tongue can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a {@dc 24} Strength check against it. A creature that touches the tongue or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage.

trait.name: Chameleon Carapace (Oni Form Only)
entries: Akuma can change the color of his carapace to match the color and texture of his surroundings. As a result, he has advantage on Dexterity (stealth) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Discorporation
entries: When Akuma drops to 0 hit points or dies, his body is destroyed but his essence travels back to Jigoku, and he is unable to take physical form for a time.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Akuma fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Akuma has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Akuma's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Akuma regenerates 30 hit points at the start of its turn if he has at least 1 hit point and isn't wet.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: Akuma deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Water Hypersensitivity
entries: Akuma takes 20 acid damage when he starts his turn fully or partially submerged in water. This damage cannot be reduced in any way. While wet, Akuma has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Akuma can use his Frightful Presence. He then attacks with any number of tongues he has available, makes two claw attacks and one gore attack.

action.name: Claw (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d8 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}47 ({@damage 6d12 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tongue (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 240 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 24}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. A creature that is {@condition grappled} at the start of its turn, takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage.

action.name: Blastwave {@recharge 4}
entries: Akuma releases a blastwave in all directions. Each creature in a 50-foot-radius sphere centered on Akuma must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) bludgeoning damage and 42 ({@damage 12d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The blaswave ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried and plant life in the area dies.

action.name: Frightful Presence (Oni Form Only)
entries: Each creature of Akuma's choice that is within 60 feet of Akuma and aware of him must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Akuma's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: Akuma magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into his true form. Other than his size, his statistics are the same in each form. If Akuma becomes wet or dies, he reverts to its true form.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Akuma makes an attack using either his claws or a tongue.

legendary.name: Conjure Spawn (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Akuma conjures forth an {@creature Akuma Spawn (Amaranthian)|MotO|akuma spawn} in an empty space he can see within 60 feet. The spawn acts on its own initiative.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Akuma makes a Wisdom (perception) check.

legendary.name: Heat
entries: Akuma increases his own body temperature to unimaginable heights for a short moment, evaporating any wet spots on his body.

Oni Lords are willed into existence within Jigoku, the Realm of Evil, by an unknown force. They cannot escape Jigoku on their own, but must be summoned by mortals in the Material Plane. Most Oni Lords can summon spawn: oni that reflect their own features to a degree.
Hundreds of cults exist within the Empire, some worshiping a single Oni Lord, while others worship several or all.

entries.name: Tainted Nature
entries: An Oni Lord doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Akuma
entries: Akuma the Incinerator is the largest of the Oni Lords, and aside from Saisho and Ebanus, he is also considered the most powerful. He is the Oni Lord of Fire and Hatred.

He has the body of a demonic bull with draconic features, his head crowned with gigantic spikes that continue along either side of his spine, with fire and smoke rising between them. Though he prefers to move on all fours, he is just as adept standing on his two hind feet, making him an enormous creature to behold. Within his fiery mouth, he has three tongues: each tongue ignited, burning with a fierce and willful fire. His massive tail looks like it could tear through even the strongest fortress. His size alone inspires terror, but his Tainted nature invites despair in even the most battlehardened veterans.

Akuma has many cult followings, most of which practice a burning of the tongue, often resulting in cultists becoming mute. The most prominent of cults are the Ashen Acolytes, a group of Wyvern that ventured deep into the Shadowlands. All cults brand their flesh with the Mark of Akuma:

entries.name: Akuma's Lair
entries: Akuma makes his lair in the Cindered Citadel, a massive structure with smoke rising from every crack. At the top stands Akuma's Throne of Embers covered in eternal flame. The Cindered Citadel looms over Akuma's layer of Jigoku, called the Scorchlands: an endless landmass of scorched earth, the terrain only broken by vulcanos and rivers of lava. The challenge rating of Akuma is 30 (155,000 XP) if he is encountered in his lair.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Byoki's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}). Byoki can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material, or verbal components:

trait.name: Discorporation
entries: When Byoki drops to 0 hit points or dies, her body is destroyed but her essence travels back to Jigoku, and she is unable to take physical form for a time.

trait.name: Pestilent
entries: A creature that touches Byoki or hits her with a melee attack while within 5 feet of her takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage.

trait.name: Pestilent Fumes (Oni Form Only)
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of Byoki must succeed on a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw or be infected by Soul Rot. On a successful saving throw, a creature is immune to Byoki's Pestilent Fumes for 24 hours.

trait.name: Inscrutable
entries: Byoki is immune to any effect that would sense her emotions or read her thoughts, as well as any divination spell that she refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain Byoki's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Byoki fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Byoki has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Byoki's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Byoki regenerates 20 hit points at the start of her turn if she has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Byoki can use her Frightful Presence. She then makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}39 ({@damage 6d10 + 6}) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Pestilent Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature in a 30-foot cone originating from Byoki must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or be coated in a disease-ridden acid. An acid-coated creature takes 70 ({@damage 20d6}) acid damage and becomes infected with Soul Rot. If another creature touches the acid-coated creature while with in 5 feet of it, it must succeed a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or also become infected with Soul Rot. A creature can remove the infectious coating on itself by using a short rest to bathe in water, alcohol, or vinegar.

action.name: Frightful Presence (Oni Form Only)
entries: Each creature of Byoki's choice that is within 60 feet of Byoki and aware of her must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Byoki's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: Byoki magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into her true form. Other than her size, her statistics are the same in each form. If Byoki dies, she reverts to her true form.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Byoki makes a melee attack.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Byoki makes a Wisdom (perception) check.

legendary.name: Conjure Spawn (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Byoki conjures forth a Byoki Spawn in an empty space she can see within 60 feet. The spawn acts on its own initiative.

legendary.name: Tendril Grab
entries: Byoki targets a creature within 100 feet of her with an elastic tendril. The target must succeed either a Strength (athletics) or a Dexterity (acrobatics) check against Byoki's Strength (athletics) check. If the target fails its check, it takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage and is pulled to an empty space within 10 feet of Byoki.

Oni Lords are willed into existence within Jigoku, the Realm of Evil, by an unknown force. They cannot escape Jigoku on their own, but must be summoned by mortals in the Material Plane. Most Oni Lords can summon spawn: oni that reflect their own features to a degree.
Hundreds of cults exist within the Empire, some worshiping a single Oni Lord, while others worship several or all.

entries.name: Tainted Nature
entries: An Oni Lord doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Byoki
entries: The Harbinger of Pestilence, also known as the Mother of Decay, is feared because of the disease she carries, as it can quickly decimate entire towns, cities, and even entire regions if not kept in check. The disease kills its victims within days, at which point the infected soon awakens as an undead who continues to spread the disease.

Byoki herself resembles an enormous winged, metallic construct, intertwined with organic matter and countless tendrils, large and small. At the far top, a vaguely humanoid torso protrudes from her construct-like body, white and ill-looking. Yet more tendrils protrude from her shoulders and the back of her head, and her face is completely black and featureless. She floats across the ground, while pseudopods and tendrils slither across the ground beneath her.

This pestilent Oni Lord does not seek to conquer, nor does she seek to merely kill: she wishes to spread her vicious disease to all things living. Cults that worship Byoki often have working laboratories, where they experiment with creating new diseases in her name. They burn the Mark of Byoki into their flesh with acid:

entries.name: Soul Rot
entries: Byoki carries an infectious disease called Soul Rot. If a living creature is infected, it becomes poisoned for the duration of the disease. The disease lasts until cured. If the disease hasn't been cured within 48 hours, the carrier dies an agonizing death and unless the remains are burned or cleansed of the disease, it rises again as a {@creature taint zombie|MotO} within 1 hour. All creatures native to the Shadowlands are immune to Soul Rot.

entries.name: Byoki's Lair
entries: Byoki's lair is the Fortress of Decay, a gigantic structure, covered in mold and pseudopods. It floats high above the Pestilent Sea: Byoki's layer of Jigoku, and an endless ocean of liquid organic matter, filled with blisters, pustules, and sores.

A creature that touches the ocean must succeed a DC 25 Strength saving throw, or be pulled under. A creature that doesn't have anything to grab onto has disadvantage on the saving throw. Once under, the creature is pulled 60 feet downwards at the start of each of its turns and each foot of movement costs four feet of movement for the creature. At the start of each of its turns, a creature must also make a DC 25 Constitution saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) necrotic damage and 55 ({@damage 10d10}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save. A creature that dies within the ocean is obliterated, as its organic mass becomes one with the ocean.
The challenge rating of Byoki is 27 (105,000 XP) if she is encountered in her lair.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Ebanus's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 25}). Ebanus can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material, or verbal components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Ebanus can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Discorporation
entries: When Ebanus drops to 0 hit points or dies, his body and his onyx blade is destroyed but his essence travels back to Jigoku, and he is unable to take physical form for a time.

trait.name: Inscrutable
entries: Ebanus is immune to any effect that would sense his emotions or read his thoughts, as well as any divination spell that he refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain Ebanus's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Ebanus fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Ebanus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Onyx Blade
entries: Ebanus wields the almighty Onyx Blade. His attacks with it are magical, and it deals extra acid, cold, and necrotic damage (included in the attack). He cannot be disarmed of this weapon. He can send it to a pocket dimension or conjure it back using a bonus action on his turn.

trait.name: Regeneration (Requires 3 Taint or higher)
entries: Ebanus regenerates 40 hit points at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Taint Aura (Requires 1 Taint or higher, True Form Only)
entries: At the start of each of Ebanus's turns, each creature within 10 feet of him takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) necrotic damage unless it is protected by jade. A creature that touches Ebanus or hits him with a melee attack while within 5 feet of him takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Taint Mastery
entries: Ebanus has such control over his own Taint, that he can adjust his own Taint score up or down by 1 by using a bonus action. While at 0 Taint, Ebanus's true nature is hidden from any spell or ability that reveals Tainted creatures, but he cannot use all of his abilities unless he has enough Taint.

trait.name: Touch of Sorrow
entries: A creature must succeed a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw at the start of its turn if it has Ebanus {@condition grappled}. On a failed save, the creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage and releases Ebanus, as it is overwhelmed by screams from the souls of those Ebanus has killed. On a successful save, the creature takes half the damage and doesn't let go of Ebanus.

trait.name: Warp Reality (Requires 8 Taint or higher)
entries: Whenever a hostile creature within 120 feet of Ebanus casts a spell of 6th level or lower, the creature must roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 4 or 5 the spell fails, but a spell slot or charge is still expended. On a roll of 6, the spell also fails, expending a spell slot as usual, and Ebanus copies the effect of the spell, and uses it immediately as he sees fit by using his reaction.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ebanus can use his Frightful Presence and his Taint Walk. He then makes two attacks, choosing between his onyx blade and his tainted gaze.

action.name: Onyx Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) slashing damage plus 13 ({@damage 2d12}) acid damage plus 13 ({@damage 2d12}) cold damage plus 13 ({@damage 2d12}) necrotic damage. Roll a {@dice d6} on successful hit if Ebanus has 5 Taint or higher. On 1 or 2, the attack becomes exceptionally volatile and deals an additional 13 ({@damage 2d12}) acid damage. On a 3 or 4, the cold spreads through the target's body, halving its movement speed until the end of its next turn. On a 5 or 6, Ebanus regains hit points equal to the amount of necrotic damage done.

action.name: Tainted Gaze (Requires 4 Taint or higher)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 120ft., one target that can see Ebanus. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) psychic damage. The target must make a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw or have its maximum hit points lowered by an amount equal to half the damage taken. If a creature's hit point maximum is reduced to 0 by this effect, the creature dies. A creature's hit point maximum can be restored with the greater restoration spell or similar magic.

action.name: Taint Walk (Requires 1 Taint or higher)
entries: Ebanus magically teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space that he can see. Ebanus gains advantage on his next attack on the same turn after teleporting.

action.name: Enthrall {@recharge}
entries: Ebanus targets one creature he can see within 60 feet of him. If the target can see Ebanus, the target must succeed on a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be {@condition charmed} by Ebanus. The {@condition charmed} target regards Ebanus's life higher than its own and is completely under Ebanus's control. Each time Ebanus or Ebanus's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until Ebanus is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.

action.name: Frightful Presence (True Form Only)
entries: Each creature of Ebanus's choice that is within 60 feet of Ebanus and aware of him must succeed on a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Ebanus's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Taint Storm {@recharge 5}
entries: Ebanus calls down a magical Taint storm at a point he can see within 500 feet of him. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: Ebanus magically polymorphs into any other creature, or back into his true form. Other than his size, his statistics are the same in each form. If Ebanus dies, he reverts to his true form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (Ebanus's choice).

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Ebanus adds 9 to his AC against one attack that would hit him. To do so, Ebanus must see the attacker and be wielding his onyx blade.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Ebanus makes an attack with his Onyx Blade.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Ebanus makes a Wisdom (perception) check.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Ebanus beats his wings. Each creature within 15 feet of him must succeed on a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw or take 15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. Ebanus can then fly up to half his flying speed.

Oni Lords are willed into existence within Jigoku, the Realm of Evil, by an unknown force. They cannot escape Jigoku on their own, but must be summoned by mortals in the Material Plane. Most Oni Lords can summon spawn: oni that reflect their own features to a degree.
Hundreds of cults exist within the Empire, some worshiping a single Oni Lord, while others worship several or all.

entries.name: Tainted Nature
entries: An Oni Lord doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Ebanus
entries: Ebanus is the youngest of the Oni Lords, but in all likelihood also the most powerful. The other Oni Lords, maybe with the exception of Saisho who doesn't care for such things, fear Ebanus and dare not cross him.

Ebanus has paradoxically given himself the title of Black Prince, though he does not command any armies, nor has he ever created spawn in his own image. He is also known as the Oni Lord of Sorrow and Strife.

Ebanus is a massively built dark-skinned humanoid with deep purple eyes and a mane of jet black, spiky hair. He has four massive bat-like wings on his back, his body is armor-like in its shape, and he wields a massive onyx blade that seems weightless to him. He is cunning, patient, ruthless beyond measure, and can blend into any society effortlessly.

There are no cults devoted to Ebanus — at least not for any length of time, as they eventually murder each other until but a single devotee remains. These zealots are usually both cunning schemers and excellent warriors. They work tirelessly to corrupt the Empire from within. They carve the Mark of Ebanus on the inside of their mouths or underneath their eyelids:

entries.name: Ebanus's Lair
entries: Ebanus's lair is the Temple of Sorrows. Above ground it is shaped like a pyramid with a flat top, stairs going up one side with {@dice 3d100} steps, leading to a door-less entrance near the top. The number of steps changes at the end of every minute.

Once inside, the structure consists of {@dice 2d4 * 10|2d4 x 10} levels, leading further and further down. Each level is filled with darkness and Taint, and no light can shine more than 5 feet before the darkness overwhelms it. If a creature stays on one level for an hour, it gains a random effect from the Jigokuan Corruption table. By spending 5 minutes and making a successful DC 15 Wisdom (survival) check, a creature can navigate to the next level.

Every level has a number of Tainted apparitions floating around. The number increases the further down the level is. The apparitions themselves are creatures that died at the hands of Ebanus, now just a mere reflection of their former selves. They are a incorporeal and translucent black. The apparitions twist and twirl in eternal agony, and their screams echo throughout the lair. They are harmless and don't respond to interaction.

The Temple of Sorrows is located within the Plains of Regret, Ebanus's layer within Jigoku. The layer stretches endlessly in every direction, and when a creature steps on the ground, blood oozes up between the ebony gravel that completely covers the entirety of the layer. It is otherwise completely featureless.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Kyoso's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 24}). Kyoso can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material, or verbal components:

trait.name: Charge
entries: If Kyoso moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 55 ({@damage 10d10}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Discorporation
entries: When Kyoso drops to 0 hit points or dies, her body is destroyed but her essence travels back to Jigoku, and she is unable to take physical form for a time.

trait.name: Inscrutable
entries: Kyoso is immune to any effect that would sense her emotions or read her thoughts, as well as any divination spell that she refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain Kyoso's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Kyoso fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Kyoso has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Kyoso's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: Kyoso can take one reaction on every turn in a combat.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Kyoso regenerates 30 hit points at the start of her turn if she has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Taint Aura (Oni Form Only)
entries: At the start of each of Kyoso's turns, each creature within 5 feet of her takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage unless it is protected by jade. A creature that touches Kyoso or hits her with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Kyoso can use her Frightful Presence. She then makes six attacks: four with her claws, one with her tail, and one gore attack. In place of doing her six attacks, she can choose to use her Tormentor Bolt twice.

action.name: Claw (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}51 ({@damage 8d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail (Oni Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tormentor Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 16} to hit, range 120/240 ft., one creature. {@h}63 ({@damage 10d10 + 8}) psychic damage. The target must succeed a DC24 Charisma saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn. If a creature dies from this attack, Kyoso is reinvigorated and regains lost hit points equal to the damage done.

action.name: Kyoso's Curse {@recharge 4}
entries: Kyoso targets up to two creatures she can see within 30 feet of her. A target must succeed on a {@dc 24} Wisdom saving throw or become cursed. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on a success. If a target dies while cursed, Kyoso regains a number of hit points equal to the creatures hit point maximum.

action.name: Taint Orb {@recharge}
entries: Kyoso hurls a magical ball of Taint that explodes at a point she can see within 120 feet of her. Each creature in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) acid damage, 35 ({@damage 10d6}) cold damage, and 35 ({@damage 10d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Frightful Presence (Oni Form Only)
entries: Each creature of Kyoso's choice that is within 60 feet of Kyoso and aware of her must succeed on a {@dc 24} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Kyoso's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: Kyoso magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into her true form. Other than her size, her statistics are the same in each form. If Kyoso dies, she reverts to its true form.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Kyoso attacks twice with her claws or once with her tail.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Kyoso makes a Wisdom (perception) check.

legendary.name: Conjure Spawn (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Kyoso conjures forth a {@creature Kyoso Spawn|MotO} in an empty space she can see within 60 feet. The spawn acts on its own initiative.

Oni Lords are willed into existence within Jigoku, the Realm of Evil, by an unknown force. They cannot escape Jigoku on their own, but must be summoned by mortals in the Material Plane. Most Oni Lords can summon spawn: oni that reflect their own features to a degree.
Hundreds of cults exist within the Empire, some worshiping a single Oni Lord, while others worship several or all.

entries.name: Tainted Nature
entries: An Oni Lord doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Kyoso
entries: Kyoso the Soul-Eater is the Oni Lord of Blood and Curses and the Lady of Torment. She is an almost indescribable mass of flesh, bones, and membrane, most of it covered in spikes. She has four arms, a pair of wings, and massive horns protruding on either side of her head. Her lower torso is that of an enormous serpent, making her slither across the ground when she isn't airborne.

She attacks by launching great bolts of tormented souls from her arms which burn the soul of the target. Kyoso loves to hunt in solitude, delighting in the chase and kill. She burrows through the earth like a great worm, and surfaces to take her victims by surprise.

The cults that follow Kyoso are among the greatest maho-tsukai, many of them aspiring to become maguses. They put the Mark of Kyoso on their flesh daily, with fresh blood either from themselves or their victims:

entries.name: Kyoso's Lair
entries: Kyoso's lair is the Veins of Torment, a vast underground network of tunnels, far below the Blood Deep — Kyoso's layer of Jigoku. The entirety of the layer is filled with blood. Reaching an entrance is almost impossible without guidance, as any creature submerged in the blood becomes blinded for the duration.

The tunnels themselves are made of flesh and membrane, filled with spikes, and blood oozing from every crevice. They stretch for countless miles, and only pure luck will allow a creature to find the inner sanctum where Kyoso resides: The Heart of Torment. The room is a 100 feet radius sphere, a third of the room filled with blood, and stairs and bridges going in random directions along the walls. The Heart of Torment is located 20 miles below the first tunnel.
A creature that takes the Dash action or lands prone, must succeed a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage on a failed save.
The challenge rating of Kyoso is 28 (120,000 XP) if she is encountered in her lair.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Nikoma's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}). Nikoma can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Discorporation
entries: When Nikoma drops to 0 hit points or dies, his body is destroyed but his essence travels back to Jigoku, and he is unable to take physical form for a time.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: Nikoma is immune to any spell or effect that would alter his form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Nikoma fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Nikoma is immune to spells of 5th level or lower unless he wishes to be affected. He has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Nikoma's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Nikoma regenerates 20 hit points at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: Nikoma has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If Nikoma moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 23} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is knocked {@condition prone}, Nikoma can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Nikoma can use his Frightful Presence. He then makes a gore attack and two claw attacks. If Nikoma reduces a creature to 0 hit points with any of these attacks, he can immediately use his Obliteration as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) piercing damage plus 33 ({@damage 6d10}) necrotic damage. The target's Taint score increases by 1.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d8 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d8 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed a {@dc 23} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Obliteration {@recharge}
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 13} to hit, range 120/600 ft., one creature that can see Nikoma. {@h}54 ({@damage 12d8}) psychic damage. If the target is a creature that has 100 hit points or fewer, it must succeed a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw or die as its body is obliterated.

action.name: Wrathful Roar {@recharge}
entries: Nikoma emits a magical roar and his physical form transforms into sound waves. Each creature within 500 feet of Nikoma and able to hear him must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 44 ({@damage 8d10}) thunder damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. At the end of Nikoma's turn, his body reforms in an empty space of his choosing that the sound waves could reach.

action.name: Frightful Presence (Oni Form Only)
entries: Each creature of Nikoma's choice that is within 60 feet of Nikoma and aware of him must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Nikoma's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Nikoma makes a claw or gore attack.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Nikoma makes a Wisdom (perception) check.

legendary.name: Recharge Obliteration (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Nikoma recharges his Obliteration.

Oni Lords are willed into existence within Jigoku, the Realm of Evil, by an unknown force. They cannot escape Jigoku on their own, but must be summoned by mortals in the Material Plane. Most Oni Lords can summon spawn: oni that reflect their own features to a degree.
Hundreds of cults exist within the Empire, some worshiping a single Oni Lord, while others worship several or all.

entries.name: Tainted Nature
entries: An Oni Lord doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Nikoma
entries: Nikoma the Destroyer is the Oni Lord of Destruction and Wrath and the Brass Obliterator. This monstrous, quadrupedal oni resembles construct more than an oni. He has eight massive horns protruding around his shoulders, and no visible eyes. He is made entirely of brass, his chest more skeletal than anything else. He possesses the strength and ferocity of a much larger creature, and he is fueled by the fire within him, which is the physical manifestation of all wrath.

Much like Ebanus, Nikoma has never bothered creating spawn; he is too wild and to preoccupied with destruction. In fact, nikoma feels a constant need to destroy and kill, which has earned him the title of Destroyer. Though he might appear feral, he is not without strategy, and is quick to adapt to new threats.

Unlike most other oni, nikoma cannot change his shape. He isn't bothered by this, however, as he has no intention of infiltration or manipulation. Nikoma attacks using brute force. He is remarkably resistant to magic, and his brass body is almost impenetrable.

The cults that worship Nikoma often sharpen their teeth and wear gloves with brass claws attached. They favor organizing rooster battles, dog fights, and gladiatorial combat. They have the Mark of Nikoma tattooed in a brazen color:

entries.name: Nikoma's Lair
entries: Nikoma's layer of Jigoku is the Wrath Wastes: A perfect replica of the Orient, though every single building is destroyed, every river and lake dried out, and every tree knocked down. In Nikoma's mind, he has already destroyed everything there is to destroy, and his layer of Jigoku tells that story. At the top of Mount Nodo, built in the center of the ruins of Takai Machi the Wyvern capital stands the fearsome Brazen Tower. The tower is 100 stories tall and 400 feet wide. At the center of the tower, however, there is a 100-foot radius circular chute, leading from top to bottom. Within the chute is a gigantic siege ram pointed downward. Nikoma periodically drops the ram to sunder the land itself he is not content with just creatures and objects. Everything must be destroyed.
The challenge rating of Nikoma is 24 (62,000 XP) if he is encountered in his lair.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Shikibu's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 24}). Shikibu can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material, or verbal components:

trait.name: Discorporation
entries: When Shikibu drops to 0 hit points or dies, his body is destroyed but his essence travels back to Jigoku, and he is unable to take physical form for a time.

trait.name: Ethereal Escape
entries: If reduced to 0 hit points, Shikibu's spirit immediately leaves his body in ethereal form. On his following turn, Shikibu's spirit can then inhabit a nearby Medium corpse by using an action, animating it and slowly transforming it into a replica of Shikibu's original form. The transformation takes {@dice 2d4 - 1} rounds, but Shikibu is fully capable of continuing battle in his new body, with all his hit points fully restored, thought he cannot fly until the transformation is complete. Shikibu can only remain in spirit form for 1 minute. He can move ethereally during that time, but cannot pass through jade. If Shikibu cannot enter a corpse during that time, he is destroyed. Shikibu's spirit cannot be forced out of a body through magical means, and once his spirit has taken hold and the body is once again destroyed, only a wish spell can bring the deceased back to life.

trait.name: Inscrutable
entries: Shikibu is immune to any effect that would sense his emotions or read his thoughts, as well as any divination spell that he refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain Shikibu's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Shikibu fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Shikibu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Shikibu's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Shikibu regenerates 30 hit points at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Taint Aura (Oni Form Only)
entries: At the start of each of Shikibu's turns, each creature within 5 feet of him takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage unless it is protected by jade. A creature that touches Shikibu or hits him with a melee attack while within 5 feet of him takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While Shikibu is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, his AC includes his Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Unnerving Aura (Oni Form Only)
entries: Each creature of Shikibu's choice that is within 30 feet of Shikibu and aware of him has disadvantage on concentration checks. Additionally, whenever an affected creature casts a spell that requires concentration, it must first succeed a {@dc 24} Wisdom saving throw, or the spell will fizzle.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Shikibu can use his Frightful Presence. He then makes two attacks with his claws or two with his Taint Blast.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) slashing damage, and the target must make on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Taint Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 16} to hit, range 120/240 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d10 + 9}) force damage. If the target is a creature, it is pushed back 10 feet.

action.name: Frightful Presence (Oni Form Only)
entries: Each creature of Shikibu's choice that is within 60 feet of Shikibu and aware of him must succeed on a {@dc 24} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Shikibu's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Taint Cloud {@recharge 4}
entries: Shikibu calls forth raw Taint in the form of a cold, cloying cloud of greasy darkness at a point he can see within 120 feet of him. The cloud has the shape of a sphere with a 40-foot radius and spreads around corners. Each creature within the cloud becomes {@condition blinded} while within the cloud and must make a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw the first time they enter the cloud during their turn, or if they start their turn within the cloud. A creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) acid damage, 28 ({@damage 8d6}) cold damage, and 28 ({@damage 8d6}) necrotic damage, lands {@condition prone}, and gains +2 to its Taint score on a failed save. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage, doesn't land {@condition prone}, and doesn't have its Taint score increased. If a creature casts a spell while within the cloud, the creature must roll on the Wild Magic Surge table. The cloud lasts for 5 rounds before dissipating.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: Shikibu magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into his true form. Other than his size, his statistics are the same in each form. If Shikibu dies, he reverts to his true form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (Shikibu's choice).

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Shikibu makes a claw attack or uses his Taint Blast.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Shikibu makes a Wisdom (perception) check.

legendary.name: Conjure Spawn (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Shikibu conjures forth a bodiless {@creature Shikibu Spawn (Corpse Walker)|MotO|Shikibu Spawn} in an empty space he can see within 60 feet. The spawn acts on its own initiative.

Oni Lords are willed into existence within Jigoku, the Realm of Evil, by an unknown force. They cannot escape Jigoku on their own, but must be summoned by mortals in the Material Plane. Most Oni Lords can summon spawn: oni that reflect their own features to a degree.
Hundreds of cults exist within the Empire, some worshiping a single Oni Lord, while others worship several or all.

entries.name: Tainted Nature
entries: An Oni Lord doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Shikibu
entries: Shikibu the Corrupter is the Oni Lord of Corruption and Deceit, also known as the Great Corpse Walker and the Undying Parasite. He is the smallest of the Oni Lords, standing only a little taller than a human. He appears as a winged humanoid creature, with the body of a giant, bipedal, gray-skinned bat, and the face of a twisted goat-man. He has two long horns protruding from his head, and a thin tail. A dark brown mane covers the top of his head, and runs along his back. Apart from Saisho, he is the oldest of the Oni Lords.

Shikibu has the ability to possess the bodies of the deceased when his mortal body is destroyed. The strain of being a vessel for Shikibu's spirit, leaves a body as a burned out husk after a few days.

He very much enjoys utilizing his superior mental faculties to manipulate those around him, and making them play right into his hand. However, when push comes to shove, Shikibu is a powerful spellcaster, and the more bodies he leaves in his wake, the harder he is to destroy.

His cultists most commonly aspire to become maho-tsukai necromancers. They try to influence both politics and public opinion from the shadows through subtle manipulation. They carve the skin of their foreheads to engrave the Mark of Shikibu into their skulls, only to reattach the skin and have the wound healed. They identify each other by touching each others foreheads, revealing the engraving underneath with a careful touch:

entries.name: Shikibu's Lair
entries: Shikibu's lair is the Hallowed Dome: a 200-foot tall, 400-foot wide perfect half-sphere. The dome is a shimmering white, and it shares the same qualities as a wall of force, except that a disintegrate spell doesn't destroy the dome. Only teleportation allows for entry into the dome.

The inside of the dome is completely covered in ice and snow. There are {@dice 1d4-1} fiend or humanoid corpses buried in the snow within every 10-foot square, and {@dice 2d4} burned out husks that Shikibu has already used. The waist-deep snow is difficult terrain. Spells that deal fire damage to an area melt the snow in the affected area, revealing any buried corpses and husks in the process.

The Hallowed Dome stands in the center of Shikibu's layer of Jigoku: the Garden of Bones. This horrid layer of Jigoku resembles a vast garden, organs growing like fruit from the bones of the dead that protrude from the ground. Eventually, the bones will grow flesh and skin, and become a humanoid corpse, unattached to any soul. Shikibu has his spawn bring these corpses to the Hallowed Dome, where they can be used as hosts for his dark spirit.
The challenge rating of Shikibu is 28 (120,000 XP) if he is encountered in his lair.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Tsuburo's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 22}). Tsuburo can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material, or verbal components:

trait.name: Discorporation
entries: When Tsuburo drops to 0 hit points or dies, his body is destroyed but his essence travels back to Jigoku, and he is unable to take physical form for a time.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: Tsuburo is immune to any spell or effect that would alter his form.

trait.name: Inscrutable
entries: Tsuburo is immune to any effect that would sense his emotions or read his thoughts, as well as any divination spell that he refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain Tsuburo's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Tsuburo fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Tsuburo has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Tsuburo's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Tsuburo regenerates 30 hit points at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Tsuburo cannot take reactions until the end of its next turn and must succeed on a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw, or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. A creature has disadvantage on the saving throw if it starts its turn within 5 feet of Tsuburo. If a creature fails its saving throw by 5 or more, it is {@condition paralyzed} until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the paralyze effect of Tsuburo's stench for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Tsuburo can use his Frightful Presence. He then makes two unarmed strikes.

action.name: Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, range 120/600 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, its movement is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) slashing damage plus 27 ({@damage 6d8}) necrotic damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}) and {@condition restrained} until this grapple ends. Tsuburo cannot use his Unarmed Strike if he is grappling two creatures.

action.name: Swallow
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10ft., one target Tsuburo has {@condition grappled}. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d10 + 5}) piercing damage. The target is swallowed and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside Tsuburo, and it takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) acid damage and has its Taint score increased by 1 at the start of each of Tsuburo's turns. Tsuburo can have only two living creatures swallowed at a time.

If Tsuburo takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from swallowed creatures, Tsuburo must succeed on a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of Tsuburo. If Tsuburo dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.
If a creature drops to 0 hit points while swallowed by Tsuburo, Tsuburo regains hit points equal to the creature's maximum hit points and the creature dies.

action.name: Throw
entries: Tsuburo throws a creature he is grappling {@dice 2d6 x 5} feet in a direction of his choosing.

action.name: Frightful Presence (Oni Form Only)
entries: Each creature of Tsuburo's choice that is within 60 feet of Tsuburo and aware of him must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Tsuburo's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Tsuburo makes an unarmed strike or uses his Throw.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Tsuburo makes a Wisdom (perception) check.

legendary.name: Swallow (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Tsuburo uses his Swallow.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: Tsuburo magically teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

Oni Lords are willed into existence within Jigoku, the Realm of Evil, by an unknown force. They cannot escape Jigoku on their own, but must be summoned by mortals in the Material Plane. Most Oni Lords can summon spawn: oni that reflect their own features to a degree.
Hundreds of cults exist within the Empire, some worshiping a single Oni Lord, while others worship several or all.

entries.name: Tainted Nature
entries: An Oni Lord doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Tsuburo
entries: Tsuburo the Gluttonous is also known as the Oni Lord of Pleasures and Sins, and the Master of Self Indulgence. He has an insatiable hunger, eating any lesser creature that gets in his way. Unlike most other Oni Lords, he has never created spawn, nor would he ever do so: Tsuburo does not wish to share his meals with anyone or anything.

He appears as a massive bloated and twisted humanoid, with broken and flobby skin from overconsumption. He has three gaping maws on his face, all three in constant chewing motion, and each leading to a separate stomach. His flesh is a soft butter-like substance, that even a child could punch through. However, his massive body is held together by his own all-consuming will, granting him godlike vigor and regeneration.

The Master of Self Indulgence is slow but calculating, though he doesn't possess the ability to change his shape Tsuburo doesn't have the patience for subtle manipulations, as it would require him to stop eating.. He can spit large amounts of corrosive, sticky saliva, which stops his food from fleeing. The stench of decomposing creatures follows him wherever he goes.
Cults that center around Tsuburo are usually cannibals. They regularly have feasts, and invited guests more often than not end up on the menu. They carve the Mark of Tsuburo onto their stomachs:

entries.name: Tsuburo's Lair
entries: Tsuburo's lair is the Dread Larder. From the outside it resembles a simple dojo, but from the inside it is an enormous larder, its walls made from flesh and the faces of the Tsuburo's victims. Chained hooks hang from the ceiling within each 5-foot square, and many have humanoid creatures hanging from them.
The Dread Larder is found within Tsuburo's layer of Jigoku: the Fleshscape. The very ground is made from the flesh of those Tsuburo has consumed. A near infinite mass of flesh and teeth.
The challenge rating of Tsuburo is 26 (90,000 XP) if he is encountered in his lair.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (3/Day)
headerEntries: The great turtle can innately cast {@spell heal} and {@spell tsunami} (spell save {@dc 23}). Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The great turtle can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The great turtle is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the great turtle fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The great turtle has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reflective Shell
entries: Any time the great turtle is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 4 or 5, the great turtle is unaffected. On a 6, the great turtle is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the great turtle, turning the caster into the target.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The great turtle uses either its Radiant Geyser or Inner Radiance ability. It then attacks twice with its claws and once with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 3d12 + 8}) piercing damage plus 22 ({@damage 4d10}) radiant damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) slashing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Inner Radiance
entries: The great turtle regenerates 20 hit points.

action.name: Radiant Geyser
entries: Each creature of the great turtle's choice within 15 feet of the great turtle must succeed a {@dc 24} Strength saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

Over the millennia, the Shijin have created great creatures in their own image. These creatures are almost as revered as the Shijin themselves, as they act as proxies for the Shijin they serve. They are known as the Serafs; guardians of virtue and the circle of life. Orochi is the exception here, as she has not created any creatures in her own image. She has, however, created serpentine creatures to help her rid the Orient of undead.

entries.name: Serafs of Genbu
entries: Eons ago Genbu created dozens of great turtles to act on his behalf, healing and protecting the weak. He hasn't been able to create more Serafs for millennia, however, as he is focused solely on keeping the Shadowlands in check, ensuring they don't spread any further.

entries.name: Great Turtle
entries: The great turtles are benevolent and kind, though only a few remain to this day. Most of them swim deep beneath the waves, conversing with Genbu telling tales of kindness and heroic deeds from the lands above, motivating Genbu to continue his eternal struggle. They look exactly like dragon turtles, though both their claws, scales, and shell are black.
It is widely believed that dragon turtles, and in fact all turtles and tortoises, are descendant from the Great Turtles.

entries.name: Immortal Nature
entries: A great turtle doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Kamic Turtle
entries: The kamic turtle is a giant turtle that is descended directly from the great turtles. Contrary to most of its cousins, however, the kamic turtle has retained some magical potency along with a keen intellect. They often act as the agents of Great Turtles, who prefer not to be seen.
Only a select few mortals ever encounter a kamic turtle, and even seeing one is considered a great blessing.
They look like giant turtles, their color varying between shades of black, brown, gray, and green.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the turtle fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Reflective Shell
entries: Any time the turtle is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 5, the turtle is unaffected. On a 6, the turtle is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the great turtle, turning the caster into the target.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The turtle attacks once with its claws and once with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d12 + 4}) piercing damage plus 22 ({@damage 4d10}) radiant damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Inner Radiance
entries: The turtle regenerates 20 hit points.

Over the millennia, the Shijin have created great creatures in their own image. These creatures are almost as revered as the Shijin themselves, as they act as proxies for the Shijin they serve. They are known as the Serafs; guardians of virtue and the circle of life. Orochi is the exception here, as she has not created any creatures in her own image. She has, however, created serpentine creatures to help her rid the Orient of undead.

entries.name: Serafs of Genbu
entries: Eons ago Genbu created dozens of great turtles to act on his behalf, healing and protecting the weak. He hasn't been able to create more Serafs for millennia, however, as he is focused solely on keeping the Shadowlands in check, ensuring they don't spread any further.

entries.name: Great Turtle
entries: The great turtles are benevolent and kind, though only a few remain to this day. Most of them swim deep beneath the waves, conversing with Genbu telling tales of kindness and heroic deeds from the lands above, motivating Genbu to continue his eternal struggle. They look exactly like dragon turtles, though both their claws, scales, and shell are black.
It is widely believed that dragon turtles, and in fact all turtles and tortoises, are descendant from the Great Turtles.

entries.name: Immortal Nature
entries: A great turtle doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Kamic Turtle
entries: The kamic turtle is a giant turtle that is descended directly from the great turtles. Contrary to most of its cousins, however, the kamic turtle has retained some magical potency along with a keen intellect. They often act as the agents of Great Turtles, who prefer not to be seen.
Only a select few mortals ever encounter a kamic turtle, and even seeing one is considered a great blessing.
They look like giant turtles, their color varying between shades of black, brown, gray, and green.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The sylvan's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 24}, spell attack +16). The sylvan can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Creature Sense
entries: While within a forest, the sylvan is aware of the presence of any other creatures within 1 mile of it that are also in the forest. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as its alignment, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell, a {@spell nondetection} spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the sylvan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The sylvan has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the sylvan moves at least 10 feet straight toward a creature right before hitting it with a claw attack, the target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the sylvan can take a bonus action to make one bite attack against it.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The sylvan can use its action to polymorph into a Medium, Large, or Huge white tiger or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sylvan uses its Thorn Vines ability and makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Thorn Vines
entries: Melee The sylvan magically causes razor sharp vines to burst from the ground at a point within 60 feet of it that it can see. Each creature of the sylvan's choice within 20 feet of that point, must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 21}). Until the grapple ends, the target is held 10 ft. above the ground, is {@condition restrained}, and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
Each vine can be attacked (AC 16; 10 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). A vine can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a {@dc 21} Strength check against it.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The sylvan makes one attack with its bite, claws, slam, or vines.

legendary.name: Cast Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The sylvan casts a spell.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The sylvan moves up to its speed.

Over the millennia, the Shijin have created great creatures in their own image. These creatures are almost as revered as the Shijin themselves, as they act as proxies for the Shijin they serve. They are known as the Serafs; guardians of virtue and the circle of life. Orochi is the exception here, as she has not created any creatures in her own image. She has, however, created serpentine creatures to help her rid the Orient of undead.

entries.name: Serafs of Kirin
entries: Kirin's Serafs are mostly pacifistic in nature, aiming to help the weak and stop conflicts through acts of kindness and advice rather than direct involvement.

entries.name: Great Sylvan
entries: Kirin's serafs are the great sylvans, thought they might also be referred to as great white tigers as well. Just like Kirin himself, they resemble large white tigers, bearded and maned, and large thorns protruding from their shoulders.
Today they are exceptionally few in number. They prefer to not reveal their presence, but instead have lesser sylvan and kamic tigers act as their agents.

entries.name: Immortal Nature
entries: A great sylvan doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Kamic Tiger
entries: Some believe that all white tigers are kamic tigers and everybody venerates them as a noble creatures that symbolize righteousness. In truth, however, kamic tigers are fey creatures that descends from the great sylvans. While it doesn't share the pacifistic views of its kin, it is still a kind creature that prefers diplomacy.

entries.name: Ki-Rin
entries: The {@creature ki-rin|VGM}, sometimes called quilin, are Kirin's most mobile agents, tasked with spreading blessings and kindness to good people. The ki-rin can be found in {@i Volo's Guide to Monsters}.

entries.name: Lesser Sylvan
entries: Lesser sylvan resemble green or white walking sticks. They prefer to observe rather than interact with creatures that aren't fey. They usually report to either a white tiger or a great sylvan, and don't engage in direct combat themselves unless forced to do so.

entries.name: Immortal Nature
entries: A lesser sylvan doesn’t require food or sleep.

monster.name: Kamic Tiger
languages: understands Kami and Sylvan but doesn't speak

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The kamic tiger has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the kamic tiger moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature right before hitting it with a claw attack, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the sylvan can take a bonus action to make one bite attack against it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kamic tiger makes two claw attacks and one bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

Over the millennia, the Shijin have created great creatures in their own image. These creatures are almost as revered as the Shijin themselves, as they act as proxies for the Shijin they serve. They are known as the Serafs; guardians of virtue and the circle of life. Orochi is the exception here, as she has not created any creatures in her own image. She has, however, created serpentine creatures to help her rid the Orient of undead.

entries: A great sylvan doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

In truth, however, kamic tigers are fey creatures that descends from the great sylvans. While it doesn't share the pacifistic views of its kin, it is still a kind creature that prefers diplomacy.

entries.name: Immortal Nature
entries: A lesser sylvan doesn’t require food or sleep.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The sylvan's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}). The sylvan can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: False Appearance (Sylvan Form Only)
entries: While the sylvan remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal stick.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The sylvan can use its action to polymorph into a Tiny insect or back into its true form. The sylvan explodes into a pile of tiny leaves if it dies, no matter which form it is in.

trait.name: Sylvan Link
entries: The sylvan can telepathically communicate with any good aligned fey creatures within 1 mile of it.

Over the millennia, the Shijin have created great creatures in their own image. These creatures are almost as revered as the Shijin themselves, as they act as proxies for the Shijin they serve. They are known as the Serafs; guardians of virtue and the circle of life. Orochi is the exception here, as she has not created any creatures in her own image. She has, however, created serpentine creatures to help her rid the Orient of undead.

entries: Kirin's Serafs are mostly pacifistic in nature, aiming to help the weak and stop conflicts through acts of kindness and advice rather than direct involvement.

entries: A great sylvan doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries: Some believe that all white tigers are kamic tigers and everybody venerates them as a noble creatures that symbolize righteousness. In truth, however, kamic tigers are fey creatures that descends from the great sylvans. While it doesn't share the pacifistic views of its kin, it is still a kind creature that prefers diplomacy.

entries: The {@creature ki-rin|VGM}, sometimes called quilin, are Kirin's most mobile agents, tasked with spreading blessings and kindness to good people. The ki-rin can be found in {@i Volo's Guide to Monsters}.
