entries: The Wyvern Clan has both a battalion of samurai that ride these wyverns (being called the Green Blades), as well as a few wu jen (being called the Nodo Skymages).

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the bharal moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 5 ({@damage 2d4}) bludgeoning damage. lf the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
entries: The bharal has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: The bharal has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

The bharal is a type of goat native to the Orient. They are active throughout the day, alternating between feeding and resting on the grassy mountain slopes. Due to their excellent camouflage and the absence of cover in their environment, bharal remain motionless when approached. Once they have been noticed, however, they scamper up to the precipitous cliffs, where they once again freeze, attempting to blend into the rock face.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The black piper can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the black piper knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The black piper ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. On a successful save the creature becomes nauseous, and takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage upon completion of it's next long rest. On a failed save, the creature feels no initial changes, but is {@condition poisoned} and becomes afflicted by excessive coughing, chills, and fever over the following day, and whenever the creature finishes a long rest, it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage, and has its maximum hit points reduced by the same amount. The venom can only be cured by a spell that cures diseases, and the reduction to a character's maximum hit points can only be cured by a greater restoration or wish spell.

The black piper is the rarest and most venomous of spiders in the Orient. They are identified by the red, hourglass-shaped mark on their black abdomens. Their favorite haunts include outhouses and piles of wood. If bitten, a healer should be sought out immediately. Everybody in the Orient knows that if bitten by the black piper, you cannot go to sleep before being cured, lest you never wake again.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The dhole has advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The dhole has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the dhole's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

The dhole is a wild dog that inhabits the forests of the Orient. This very social dog makes a variety of noises, including whistles, clucks and high-pitched screams. It has a red-brown coat and a black-tipped tail. Adults are about 3 feet long with a tail a little over a foot long. Dholes hunt in small packs of five to twelve (or more). Like other dogs, they find their prey using their keen sense of smell and then chase down the prey. Dholes are very good swimmers, and often chase their prey into the water to help catch it. They swallow meat in large chunks.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The fennec fox has advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

The fennec fox is a small nocturnal fox, native to dry and desert regions. Its most distinctive feature is its unusually large ears, which also serve to dissipate heat. In addition, its hearing is sensitive enough to hear prey moving underground. It mainly eats insects, small mammals, and birds.

They live in pairs of two, and their offspring stay with the family until they go out to create a family of their own. Families of fennecs dig out dens in the ground for habitation and protection, which often adjoin the dens of other families.
Fennecs have also been domesticated in the Orient, their primary function serving as pets for women of nobility.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The fly doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

reaction.name: Fly Away
entries: When a melee attack misses the fly, it can move up to its speed.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The toad's long jump is up to 15 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Fireball
entries: The toad exhales a small fireball, targeting a point within 30 feet of it. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 4d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.
Giant fire toads are about 4 feet long and weigh about 100 pounds. Their skin is bright red and covered with rough, purple bumps.
Fire toads rarely attack unless threatened, molested, or defending their lairs. They do not attack with their tongues as other toads do, but exhale small fireballs at their enemies.

trait.name: Chameleon Skin
entries: The toad can change the color of its skin to match the color and texture of its surroundings. As a result, it has advantage on Dexterity (stealth) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Poisonous Skin
entries: A creature that touches the toad or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage and becomes {@condition poisoned} until cured.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The toad's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The toad attacks with its tongue, uses Reel, and uses Swallow. Alternatively, it uses its bite twice.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Reel
entries: The toad pulls a creature {@condition grappled} by it up to 20 feet straight toward it.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The toad makes one bite attack against a Small or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the toad, and it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the toad's turns. The toad can have only one target swallowed at a time. If the toad dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 20 ft., one Small or smaller creature. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and the toad can't use its tongue on another target.

Giant gold spotted toads average about 5 feet long and weigh 150 to 200 pounds, with females typically being larger than males. Their skin is universally dry, rough to the touch, and bumpy. Adult gold spotted toads are aposematic (warning predators of its toxicity) with bright colors, their coloration ranging from mint green to yellow to orange. No matter its coloration, it has bright, golden spots across its bumpy skin, and it has the ability to change its coloration and texture to its surroundings, making it very hard to locate.

The gold spotted toad's skin is densely coated in an alkaloid toxin. This poison prevents its victim's nerves from transmitting impulses, leaving the muscles in an inactive state of contraction. The toad's toxin does not readily deteriorate, even when transferred to another surface, making it perfect for coating weapons (although the usage of poisons is outlawed and considered dishonorable).

If a gold spotted toad is harvested for its toxin, it provides enough for coating five weapons. The toxin is a contact poison. A creature subjected to the poison takes {@damage 1d8} damage and becomes {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the honey badger can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Frenzied Twist
entries: The honey badger has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The honey badger has advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the honey badger takes 20 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The honey badger attacks once with its bite and three times with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}) and {@condition restrained} until this grapple ends. While it is a grappling a creature, the honey badger can only use its bite attack against the {@condition grappled} creature, and it cannot grapple another creature.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 10 ft. , one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Cold Aura
entries: At the start of each of the toad's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage. A creature that touches the toad or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The toad's long jump is up to 25 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The toad attacks with its tongue, uses Reel, and uses Swallow. Alternatively, it uses its bite twice.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Reel
entries: The toad pulls a creature {@condition grappled} by it up to 30 feet straight toward it.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The toad makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the toad, and it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the toad's turns. The toad can have only one target swallowed at a time. If the toad dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} +6 to hit, reach 30 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and the toad can't use its tongue on another target.

Giant ice toads are 8 feet long and weigh 400 pounds or more. Their bumpy skin is dead white, shading to pale blue on their warty lumps. They are moderately intelligent, and actively collect gems and jewelry, particularly diamonds.
Though they are more intelligent than mere animals, ice toads are still too dim for complicated tactics. They attack just about anything and fight brutally.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The panda makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the honey badger can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Frenzied Twist
entries: The honey badger has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The honey badger has advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The honey badger attacks once with its bite and once with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

The honey badger has a fairly long body, but is distinctly thick-set and broad across the back. Its skin is remarkably loose, and allows it to turn and twist freely within it. It has short and sturdy legs, with five toes on each foot. The feet are armed with very strong claws, which are short on the hind legs and remarkably long on the forelimbs. Although mostly solitary, honey badgers may hunt together in pairs during their breeding season. They live alone in self-dug holes.

trait.name: Living Ice
entries: A creature that touches the ice spider takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
entries: The ice spider has advantage on Dexterity (stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The ice spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The ice spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw. taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the cold damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition petrified} for 1 hour as it is frozen solid. The creature is {@condition petrified} for the duration even after regaining hit points.

These ferocious creatures are very aggressive and attack humanoids on sight. Ice spiders don't exist naturally, but are instead conjured into existence by powerful dokufu. Sometimes, however, a few ice spiders skitter away after being conjured, living out the rest of their lives high up in the mountains. They often serve as a warning that a dokufu nest is nearby. Luckily, they are unable to reproduce on their own, immensely reducing the threat they pose to travelers.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The jishin mushi has advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Tremor Absorbant
entries: The jishin mushi is immune to the effects of tremors.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 4d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Create Tremor
entries: The jishin mushi smashes its abdomen into the ground, creating tremors around it. For each consecutive round the jishin mushi continues to do so, the magnitude of the tremors increases. The affected area becomes difficult terrain while the tremors last.

items.name: 1st round:
items.entry: Each creature within 10 feet of the jishin mushi must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. The tremors last until the end of the jishin mushi's next turn.

items.name: 2nd round:
items.entry: Each creature within 15 feet of the jishin mushi must succeed a DC14 Strength saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The tremors last for two rounds.

items.name: 3rd round:
items.entry: Each creature within 20 feet of the jishin mushi must make a DC14 Strength saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage and being knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, and half the amount of damage on a successful save. Creatures within 10 feet of the epicenter have disadvantage on the saving throw. The tremors last for three rounds.

entries: The jishin mushi is a giant carnivorous insect. Also known as the earthquake beetle, it is capable of generating tremors of extraordinary magnitude. It has six legs and a plump body. A tough, bluegreen carapace covers its back, while thick gray plates protect its underside. Its legs are covered with black bristles and end in flat, bony hooks. These hooks are useless as weapons but helpful for digging. The earthquake beetle's carapace conceals a pair of wing sheaths. When it takes flight, the beetle raises the sheathes to expose four wings. Two antler-like feelers extend from the top of the creature's head. Both are covered with tiny hairs. The feelers are the beetle's primary sensory organs, providing a powerful sense of smell.
The jishin mushi is not aggressive by nature, attacking only to defend itself and to kill edible prey. It has powerful mandibles which can easily kill large animals.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The lemming has advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on smell.

The lemming is a small, mouse-like rodent. The population numbers of this animal fluctuate greatly over a period of 3 to 4 years; their numbers soar, which causes the animals to leave their homes and scatter in all directions, which leads to a severe reduction in their numbers. They live less than 2 years in the wild. Lemmings eat moss and grass and live in woods, marshes, and meadows. They range from 3 to 6 inches long plus a very short tail.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The loris has advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d6 - 2}) piercing damage.

The loris is a arboreal, solitary mammal that lives in trees. It is nocturnal, most active at night. The loris is usually between 7 and 15 inches long, it has enormous eyes, grasping fingers, and toes with opposable digits. As an omnivore, it eats mostly insects, lizards, fruits, and some plant shoots.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The pika has advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on hearing.

The pika is closely related to rabbits and hares, but they are smaller and much noisier; they bark and bleat. Pikas live in cold, dry areas (high-altitude mountain slopes, deserts and grasslands). They are territorial and mark their range with scent from cheek glands. Pikas are social mammals, living in colonies or families. Desert- and grassland-dwelling pikas live in burrows; mountain-dwelling pikas live in rock crevices. They eat grasses, herbs, leaves, bark, and twigs. They stockpile huge amounts of food in a giant pile, which they will need when food is scarce in winter. Pikas are about 6 to 10 inches long and weigh 6 to 14 ounces. They have big ears and good hearing. The fur is soft; it is gray-brown on top and white on the belly.

trait.name: Venomous Scales
entries: A creature that touches the pufferfish or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it and while the pufferfish's size is Small takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The pufferfish can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Puff
entries: The pufferfish can use its action to gulp water in or out, either increasing its size to Small or returning to its regular Tiny size.

When the pufferfish is threatened, it puffs up to about twice its normal size by gulping water. Pufferfish is considered a delicacy, though it is a very poisonous fish. Luckily, it isn't nearly as venomous as it is poisonous.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the red fox can use a bonus action to take the Dash,
Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The red fox has advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The panda has advantage on Wisdom (perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Venomous Membrane
entries: A creature that touches the jellyfish or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the {@condition poisoned} creature suffers 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage, becomes {@condition poisoned} for 24 hours, and must repeat the saving throw at the end of every hour. With each failed save, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6}. On a successful save the creature takes half damage, but is still {@condition poisoned} for the duration. While {@condition poisoned} the creature cannot regain hit points by any means.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The jellyfish can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Cnidocyte
entries: {@atk mw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}The target becomes infected by the jellyfish's venom. See the Venomous Membrane trait.

Touching a shadowlands jellyfish in the Orient can have dire consequences. It causes severe chest pains almost immediately upon contact. Necrosis of the skin, swelling of the throat, and slowing of the heart sets in shortly thereafter.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the shar pei can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The shar pei has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shar pei attacks two times with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature it is {@condition grappled}. While the shar pei has a creature {@condition grappled}, it cannot bite creatures other than the one it has {@condition grappled}, but it has advantage on attack rolls against the {@condition grappled} creature.

The shar pei is a unique and intelligent breed of dog known for its black-blue tongue and deep wrinkles. Small, triangle ears, sand-colored fur, and a high-set tail also give the shar pei a unique look. They are used for guarding, herding, hunting, tracking, and as fighting dogs. The shar pei is often suspicious of strangers, which pertains to their origin as a guard dog. It is a very independent and reserved breed. Nevertheless, the shar pei is extremely devoted, loyal and affectionate to its family and is amenable to accepting strangers given time and proper introduction at a young age. If poorly socialized or trained, it can become especially territorial and aggressive.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice verse, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Small jellyfish. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points. A creature that starts its turn in the same space as the swarm while underwater must succeed a {@dc 15} Wisdom (survival) check or become disoriented and unable to discern which direction is which. Roll a {@dice d6} to randomly determine which direction the creature believes to be up.

trait.name: Venomous Membrane
entries: A creature that touches the swarm or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the {@condition poisoned} creature suffers 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage, becomes {@condition poisoned} for 24 hours, and must repeat the saving throw at the end of every hour. With each failed save, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6}. On a successful save the creature takes half damage, but is still {@condition poisoned} for the duration. While {@condition poisoned} the creature cannot regain hit points by any means.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The swarm can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swarm makes four cnidocyte attacks, or two cnidocyte attacks if it has half of its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Cnidocyte
entries: {@atk mw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}The target becomes infected by the jellyfish's venom. See the Venomous Membrane trait.

Touching a shadowlands jellyfish in the Orient can have dire consequences. It causes severe chest pains almost immediately upon contact. Necrosis of the skin, swelling of the throat, and slowing of the heart sets in shortly thereafter.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the yak moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: The yak has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The yak makes two gore attacks.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

Yaks are large, long-haired, horned mammals that live in mountainous regions. A yak measures from 3 to 6 feet tall at the shoulder and weighs up to 1,800 pounds with males being larger than females. Yaks have a massive, low-slung body, a huge hump on their shoulders, and hoofed feet. Yaks have very long fur, and during the winter, they also grow a short, thick fur undercoat which insulates them from the cold. They are herbivores that graze on grasses, but also browse on the leaves of low-lying shrubs and herbs.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the red fox can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Blink Strike
entries: Once on each of its turns, when attacking with its nodachi, the blademaster can teleport up to 30 feet right before making the attack. The blademaster makes its next attack with advantage, and deals an additional 21 ({@dice 6d6}) with that attack if it connects.

trait.name: Grace
entries: The kensai cannot suffer from disadvantage when attacking with its nodachi.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the blademaster is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Weapon Bond
entries: The blademaster can summon its nodachi into its hand using a bonus action.
The blademaster can't be disarmed of its nodachi unless {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blademaster attacks three times with its nodachi.

action.name: Nodachi
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

monster.name: Elementalist
languages: Druidic plus any one language (usually Oriental)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The elementalist is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the elementalist fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Bo
entries: {@atk mw} +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh or if wielded with two hands

monster.name: Fey Touched
languages: Druidic plus any one language (usually Oriental)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The fey touched is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

action.name: Bo
entries: {@atk mw} +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh or if wielded with two hands.

action.name: Heart Sight
entries: The fey touched touches a creature and magically discerns its current emotional state. The target must succeed a {@dc 12} Charisma saving throw, or the fey touched also learns the target's alignment. Celestials, fiends, and undead automatically fail the saving throw.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The geisha is an 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The geisha can cast disguise charm person at will and has the following bard spells prepared, which it can cast without requiring material components:

trait.name: Countercharm
entries: The geisha and its allies within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Infatuation
entries: Hostile creatures within 30 feet of the geisha have disadvantage on saving throws against the geisha's magic.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The geisha casts a spell and makes two attacks with its war fan.

action.name: War Fan
entries: {@atk mw} +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the samurai fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The samurai regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Relentless
entries: If the samurai takes 20 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The samurai makes three attacks with its nodachi or hankyu.

action.name: Nodachi
entries: {@atk mw} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hankyu
entries: {@atk rw} +4 to hit, range (80/320), one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The samurai is a 5th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The samurai knows the following ranger spells:

trait.name: Ancestral Favor (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The samurai adds +3 to an attack roll. If the attack connects, it deals an additional 10 slashing damage.

trait.name: Weapon Bond
entries: The samurai can summon its wakizashi into its hand using a bonus action. The samurai can't be disarmed of its wakizashi unless {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The samurai uses its Tactical Command ability. It then makes three attacks with its wakizashi or daikyu.

action.name: Wakizashi
entries: {@atk mw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Daikyu
entries: {@atk rw} +6 to hit, range (150/600), one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tactical Command {@recharge 4}
entries: One of the samurai's allies within 30 feet of it, can use its reaction to either make a single attack or move up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

monster.name: Itta
languages: understands Kami, Sylvan, and Oriental, but doesn't speak

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) damage.

An itta's soul is forever connected to the lu that created it. Short of a wish spell, the transformation into an itta can only be reversed with a greater restoration spell after its lu master has been slain. An itta will defend its lu master at any cost and it has no other goal in life.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The samurai is a 5th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The samurai has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Niten Parry
entries: The samurai's AC increases by 1, as long as it is wielding both its katana and its wakizashi.

trait.name: Weapon Bond
entries: The samurai can summon its katana into its hand using a bonus action. The samurai can't be disarmed of its katana unless {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The samurai attacks three times with its katana and twice with its wakizashi.
Alternatively, it can attack three times with its daikyu.

action.name: Katana
entries: {@atk mw} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Wakizashi
entries: {@atk mw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Daikyu
entries: {@atk rw} +6 to hit, range (150/600), one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Clash (1/Turn)
entries: The samurai deals an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) force damage with a successful attack.

trait.name: Grace
entries: The samurai cannot suffer from disadvantage when attacking with its nodachi.

trait.name: Weapon Bond
entries: The samurai can summon its weapon into its hand using a bonus action. The samurai can't be disarmed of its weapon unless {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The samurai makes two attacks with its nodachi.

action.name: Nodachi
entries: {@atk mw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hankyu
entries: {@atk rw} +3 to hit, range (80/320), one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

Samurai are the noble warriors of the Orient. The samurai statblock shows a regular samurai, though samurai often differ between clans. If you want to flavor a samurai from a particular clan, add the statistics from one of the clans below to the samurai statblock.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Nature +3, Performance +4

entries.name: Ckickadee Cunning
entries: The samurai has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

entries.name: AC
entries: 17 (lamellar)

entries.name: Skills
entries: Perception +3, Survival +3

entries.name: Senses
entries: passive Perception 13

entries.name: Crawdad Stance
entries: The samurai's AC increases by 1. In addition, the samurai can neither be knocked prone nor critically hit.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Deception +4

entries.name: Master of Disguises
entries: The samurai has a disguise kit and gains a +8 bonus when attempting to disguise itself.

entries.name: Speed
entries: 50 ft.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Insight +3, Persuasion +4

entries.name: Heron Stance
entries: The samurai can take the Dash or Dodge actions as a bonus action.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Animal Handling +3, Persuasion +4

entries.name: Born Rider
entries: The samurai has advantage on checks to remain mounted.

entries.name: Pegasus Stance
entries: While mounted, the samurai's mount has its speed increased by 30 ft. and attacks against the samurai or its mount are made with disadvantage.

entries.name: Damage Resistances
entries: fire, lightning, psychic, thunder

entries.name: Skills
entries: Arcana +2, Religion +3

entries.name: Phoenix Resilience
entries: The samurai has advantage on saving throws against being charmed.

entries.name: Phoenix Stance
entries: When the samurai is reduced to 0 hit points, it can make a Constitution saving throw (DC 5 + damage taken). On a success, the samurai drops to 1 hit point instead. The samurai cannot attempt a Constitution saving throw if it is reduced to 0 hit points by a critical hit or by necrotic damage.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Medicine +3, Nature +3

entries.name: Forest Born
entries: Difficult terrain caused by plants doesn't slow the samurai's movement.

entries.name: Small Build
entries: The samurai counts as one size smaller for the purpose of determining cover.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Animal Handling +3

entries.name: Speak with Rhinoceroses
entries: Through sounds and gestures, the samurai can communicate simple ideas with rhinos.

entries.name: Tool and Kit Proficiency
entries: The samurai has both smith's tools and a climber's kit. The samurai gains a +4 bonus when using them.

entries.name: Extra Proficiencies
entries: The samurai has a set of Navigator's Tools. Additionally, the samurai gains a +4 bonus when using the tools and when commandeering Vehicles (water).

entries.name: Heightened Senses
entries: The samurai has advantage on a Dexterity saving throws.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Acrobatics +3, Stealth +5

entries.name: Spider Stance
entries: The samurai can deal an additional 5 (1d10) force damage on its first successful attack on its turn.

entries.name: Swamp Lander
entries: Difficult terrain caused by swamps doesn't slow the samurai's movement. Additionally, the samurai has advantage on saving throws against wilderness hazards such as quicksand and razorvine.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Intimidation +4, History +3

entries.name: Tiger Endurance
entries: Any damage the samurai takes is reduced by 2.

entries.name: Tiger Stance
entries: The samurai and its allies within 10 feet of it gain 2 temporary hit points at the end of each of the samurai's turns. Additionally, the samurai and its allies within 10 feet of it, can add 2 to their first attack roll each turn.

entries.name: Speak with Tigers
entries: Through sounds and gestures, the samurai can communicate simple ideas with tigers.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Insight +3

entries.name: Master of Disguises
entries: The samurai has a disguise kit and gains a +8 bonus when attempting to disguise itself.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Perception +3, Performance +4

entries.name: Senses passive
entries: Perception 13

entries.name: Mask of the Wild
entries: The samurai can attempt to hide when lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries.name: Musician
entries: The samurai has an instrument and gains a +4 bonus when playing it.

entries.name: Speed
entries: 35 ft.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Athletics +6, Nature +3

entries.name: Condition Immunities
entries: frightened

entries.name: Skills
entries: Insight +3, Perception +3

entries.name: Senses
entries: passive Perception 13

entries.name: Climber's Kit Proficiency
entries: The samurai has a climber's kit and gains a +4 bonus when using it.

entries.name: Mountain Born
entries: The samurai is naturally adapted to cold climates and is acclimated to high altitudes, including elevations above 20,000 feet.

entries.name: Wyvern Stance
entries: Attacks against the samurai cannot be made with advantage.

trait.name: Camouflage
entries: The samurai has advantage on Dexterity (stealth) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The samurai regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Heightened Senses
entries: The samurai has advantage on a Dexterity saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The samurai makes three attacks with its nodachi or hankyu.

action.name: Nodachi
entries: {@atk mw} +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hankyu
entries: {@atk rw} +4 to hit, range (80/320), one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The shaman is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The shaman can cast disguise bless and sanctuary at will and has the following cleric spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The geisha casts a spell and makes two attacks with its war fan.

action.name: Tetsubo
entries: {@atk mw} +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Efflorescence (Recharges after a Short or Long rest)
entries: The shaman magically restores 18 hit points, divided as the shaman sees fit between itself and allies within 30 feet of it.

action.name: Turn Undead (Recharges after a Short or Long rest)
entries: Each undead that can see or hear the shaman within 30 feet of the shaman must make a DC14 Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw and its CR is 1 or lower, it is destroyed. If the creature fails its saving throw and its CR is 2 or higher, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from the shaman as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of the shaman. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action.

trait.name: Grace
entries: The kensai cannot suffer from disadvantage when attacking with its ninja-to.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the spy can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Ninjutsu
entries: The shinobi's attacks are ki-empowered. When the shinobi hits with its ninja-to, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d6} force damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Superior Invisibility
entries: As a bonus action, the shinobi can magically turn {@condition invisible} until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the shinobi wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the shinobi is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Weapon Bond
entries: The shinobi can summon its ninja-to into its hand using a bonus action. The shinobi can't be disarmed of its ninja-to unless {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shinobi makes three attacks in any combination.

action.name: Crescent Sweep
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., all targets. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing or slashing damage.

action.name: Ninja-to
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing or slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) force damage. If the target is a creature, the shinobi can choose one of the following additional effects:

items: The target must succeed a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, or lose the ability to make opportunity attacks until the beginning of its next turn.
The target must succeed a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, or have its speed halved until the beginning of the shinobi's next turn.

action.name: Ki Shuriken {@recharge 5}
entries: A line of pure spiritual energies 5 feet wide and 30 feet long bursts from the shinobi's ninja-to. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 18 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The shogai is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Wild Magic
entries: Roll on the wild magic table when the shogai casts a spell.

action.name: Bo
entries: {@atk mw} +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh or if wielded with two hands.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The shugenja is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The shugenja can cast disguise bless and sanctuary at will and has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Elemental Points (Recharges after a Short or Long rest)
entries: The shugenja has a pool of 6 elemental points.

trait.name: Metamagic
entries: The shugenja has access to the following metamagic:

items.name: Quickened Spell
items.entry: By expending 2 elemental points, the shugenja can cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action, using only a bonus action.

items.name: Twinned Spell
items.entry: When casting a spell that targets only one creature and doesn't have a range of self, the shugenja can spend a number of elemental points equal to the spell's level to target a second creature in range with the same spell (1 elemental point if the spell is a cantrip).

trait.name: Sense Elements
entries: The shugenja can sense any sources of air, earth, fire, and water within 300 feet of it.

action.name: Bo
entries: {@atk mw} +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands or shillelagh.

action.name: Turn Elementals, Fiends, and Undead (Recharges after a Short or Long rest)
entries: Each elemental, fiend, and undead that can see or hear the shugenja within 30 feet of the shugenja must make a DC16 Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw and it's a CR 2 or lower undead, it is destroyed. If the creature fails its saving throw and it's an elemental, fiend, or CR 3 or higher undead, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from the shugenja as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of the shugenja. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action.

monster.name: Skirmisher
languages: Thieves' cant plus any one language (usually Oriental)

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the spy can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the skirmisher is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the skirmisher instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Skirmish Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The skirmisher deals an extra 16 ({@damage 5d6}) damage when it hits a target with a ranged weapon attack and spent at least half of its movement prior to making the attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shinobi makes two attacks with its hankyu.

action.name: Hankyu
entries: {@atk rw} +7 to hit, range 80/320., one target. {@h}7 ({@dice 1d6 + 4}) piercing.

action.name: Wakizashi
entries: {@atk mw} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@dice 1d6 + 4}) slashing.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The samurai is a 5th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The samurai has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Divine Smite
entries: When the samurai hits a creature with a melee attack, the samurai can expend one spell slot to deal radiant damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage.
The extra damage is {@dice 2d8} for a 1st-level spell slot, plus {@dice 1d8} for each spell level higher than 1st. The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} if the target is an undead or a fiend.

trait.name: Weapon Bond
entries: The samurai can summon its weapon into its hand using a bonus action.
The samurai can't be disarmed of its weapon unless {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The samurai makes two attacks with its nodachi or hankyu.

action.name: Nodachi
entries: {@atk mw} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hankyu
entries: {@atk rw} +4 to hit, range (80/320), one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Deflection
entries: When one of the samurai's allies within 5 ft. of the samurai is struck with a melee attack, the samurai can use its reaction to increase the ally's AC by 3, potentially making the attack miss.

trait.name: Brawn Teachings
entries: When the samurai hits a creature with its nodachi, it deals an additional 4 damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Feral Instinct
entries: The samurai cannot be surprised.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the samurai can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the samurai takes 10 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Weapon Bond
entries: The samurai can summon its weapon into its hand using a bonus action.
The samurai can't be disarmed of its weapon unless {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The samurai makes two attacks with its nodachi or hankyu.

action.name: Nodachi
entries: {@atk mw} +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage. If the samurai scores a critical hit, it rolls damage dice three times, instead of twice.

action.name: Hankyu
entries: {@atk rw} +4 to hit, range (80/320), one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wu-jen is a 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The wu-jen can cast {@spell detect magic} and {@spell earth tremor|XGE} at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Brutal Spells
entries: The wu-jen scores a critial hit on a 19 or 20 with its spell attacks.

trait.name: Mastery of Earth
entries: The wu-jen has advantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration.

trait.name: Watchful Spirit
entries: The wu-jen has advantage on initiative rolls.

action.name: Tanto
entries: {@atk mw,rw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60, one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wu-jen is a 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The wu-jen can cast {@spell detect magic} and {@spell burning hands} at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Brutal Spells
entries: The wu-jen scores a critial hit on a 19 or 20 with its spell attacks.

trait.name: Mastery of Fire
entries: Using a bonus action, the wu-jen can burn up to four hit dice to regain 5 ({@dice 1d8 + 1}) hit points per hit die burnt. The wu-jen has a pool of 18 hit dice.

trait.name: Watchful Spirit
entries: The wu-jen has advantage on initiative rolls.

action.name: Tanto
entries: {@atk mw,rw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60, one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Fire Empowerment
entries: When another creature within 60 feet of the wu-jen casts a spell that deals fire damage, the creature must make a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the spell targets the caster rather than the intended target.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wu-jen is a 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The wu-jen can cast {@spell detect magic} and {@spell attraction|HotO} at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Brutal Spells
entries: The wu-jen scores a critial hit on a 19 or 20 with its spell attacks.

trait.name: Mastery of Metal
entries: The wu-jen's AC magically increases by 1.

trait.name: Watchful Spirit
entries: The wu-jen has advantage on initiative rolls.

action.name: Tanto
entries: {@atk mw,rw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60, one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wu-jen is a 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The wu-jen can cast {@spell detect magic} and {@spell ice knife|XGE} at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Brutal Spells
entries: The wu-jen scores a critial hit on a 19 or 20 with its spell attacks.

trait.name: Mastery of Water
entries: The wu-jen's hit point maximum increases by 36.

trait.name: Watchful Spirit
entries: The wu-jen has advantage on initiative rolls.

action.name: Tanto
entries: {@atk mw,rw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60, one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Ice Block (Recharges on a Short or Long rest)
entries: When taking damage, the wu-jen encases itself in a block of ice right before the triggering attack connects, giving the wu-jen vulnerability to fire damage, but immunity to all other damage types.
The wu-jen can end the effect as an action. The effect can also end early if the wu-jen takes 18 fire damage or more on a single round.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wu-jen is a 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The wu-jen can cast {@spell detect magic} and {@spell color spray} at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Brutal Spells
entries: The wu-jen scores a critial hit on a 19 or 20 with its spell attacks.

trait.name: Mastery of Wood
entries: The wu-jen cannot lose more than 36 hit points each time it takes damage.

trait.name: Watchful Spirit
entries: The wu-jen has advantage on initiative rolls.

action.name: Bo
entries: {@atk mw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The nat's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 11}, +3 bonus to spell attacks). The nat can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material, or verbal components:

trait.name: Bless Aura
entries: The house the nat occupies and its occupants are affected by the bless spell.
The spell doesn't effect creatures with any evil alignment.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nat has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nat attacks twice with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@dice 1d6 + 3}) dama

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The nat's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 11}, +3 bonus to spell attacks). The nat can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material, or verbal components:

trait.name: Bless Aura
entries: The house the nat occupies and its occupants are affected by the bless spell.
The spell doesn't effect creatures with any evil alignment.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nat has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nat attacks twice with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the obake dies, its hive shatters and creatures within 30 feet of it must succeed a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become confused. A confused creature cannot take reactions and must roll a {@dice d10} at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn:

rows: The creature uses all its movement to move in a random direction. To determine the direction, roll a {@dice d8} and assign a direction to each die face. The creature doesn't take an action this turn.
The creature doesn't move or take actions this turn.
The creature uses its action to make a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach. If there is no creature within its reach, the creature does nothing this turn.
The creature can act and move normally.

entries: At the end of each of its turns, an affected target can make a Wisdom saving throw. If it succeeds, this effect ends for that target.

trait.name: Cape of Wasps
entries: As a bonus action on its turn, the obake can release or withdraw a cloud of wasps. The wasps fill the obake's space, granting it three-quarters cover. A creature that touches the obake or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it while the cloud is up, takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The obake has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Otherworldly Awareness
entries: The obake knows the exact location of any creature within 60 feet of it, as long as they aren't fully submerged in water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The obake uses its Releases Swarm twice and its Release Plague once.

action.name: Release Plague
entries: Swarming, stinging wasps fill a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of the obake's choice within 300 feet of it that it can see. The sphere spreads around corners. The sphere remains for 1 minute, and its area is lightly obscured. The sphere's area is difficult terrain. When the area appears, each creature in it apart must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d10} piercing damage plus {@damage 2d10} poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. The obake itself and its released swarms are not affected by the plague. Two plagues can overlap, but then count as a single, larger plague.

action.name: Release Swarm
entries: The obake releases a swarm of wasps (variant swarm of insects) into a space within 10 feet of it. The swarm acts at the end of the obake's turns. While the obake is alive, it telepathically controls the swarm's actions. If the obake dies, the swarm is angered and relentlessly attacks the obake's slayers. The swarm is immune to the obake's Death Throes trait.

action.name: Teleport
entries: The obake magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

An obake appears as a kindly, elderly man or woman, seemingly carrying a large wicker basket. In truth, however, the obake is a cursed creature of otherworldly origin, carrying a massive wasp hive on its back. Within its hive live hundreds of thousands of wasps, each of which the obake can command for a wide range of different tasks.

entries.name: Live to Kill
entries: An obake murders for murder's sake, more than capable of laying waste to entire villages, only stopping when its own life is cut short. However, even in death, an obake is a harbinger of chaos and destruction.

entries.name: Otherworldly Nature
entries: An obake doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the turtle fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Reflective Shell
entries: Any time the turtle is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 5, the turtle is unaffected. On a 6, the turtle is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the great turtle, turning the caster into the target.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The turtle attacks once with its claws and once with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d12 + 4}) piercing damage plus 22 ({@damage 4d10}) radiant damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Inner Radiance
entries: The turtle regenerates 20 hit points.

Over the millennia, the Shijin have created great creatures in their own image. These creatures are almost as revered as the Shijin themselves, as they act as proxies for the Shijin they serve. They are known as the Serafs; guardians of virtue and the circle of life. Orochi is the exception here, as she has not created any creatures in her own image. She has, however, created serpentine creatures to help her rid the Orient of undead.

entries.name: Serafs of Genbu
entries: Eons ago Genbu created dozens of great turtles to act on his behalf, healing and protecting the weak. He hasn't been able to create more Serafs for millennia, however, as he is focused solely on keeping the Shadowlands in check, ensuring they don't spread any further.

entries.name: Great Turtle
entries: The great turtles are benevolent and kind, though only a few remain to this day. Most of them swim deep beneath the waves, conversing with Genbu telling tales of kindness and heroic deeds from the lands above, motivating Genbu to continue his eternal struggle. They look exactly like dragon turtles, though both their claws, scales, and shell are black.
It is widely believed that dragon turtles, and in fact all turtles and tortoises, are descendant from the Great Turtles.

entries.name: Immortal Nature
entries: A great turtle doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Kamic Turtle
entries: The kamic turtle is a giant turtle that is descended directly from the great turtles. Contrary to most of its cousins, however, the kamic turtle has retained some magical potency along with a keen intellect. They often act as the agents of Great Turtles, who prefer not to be seen.
Only a select few mortals ever encounter a kamic turtle, and even seeing one is considered a great blessing.
They look like giant turtles, their color varying between shades of black, brown, gray, and green.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (3/Day)
headerEntries: The great turtle can innately cast {@spell heal} and {@spell tsunami} (spell save {@dc 23}). Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The great turtle can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The great turtle is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the great turtle fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The great turtle has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reflective Shell
entries: Any time the great turtle is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 4 or 5, the great turtle is unaffected. On a 6, the great turtle is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the great turtle, turning the caster into the target.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The great turtle uses either its Radiant Geyser or Inner Radiance ability. It then attacks twice with its claws and once with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 3d12 + 8}) piercing damage plus 22 ({@damage 4d10}) radiant damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) slashing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Inner Radiance
entries: The great turtle regenerates 20 hit points.

action.name: Radiant Geyser
entries: Each creature of the great turtle's choice within 15 feet of the great turtle must succeed a {@dc 24} Strength saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

Over the millennia, the Shijin have created great creatures in their own image. These creatures are almost as revered as the Shijin themselves, as they act as proxies for the Shijin they serve. They are known as the Serafs; guardians of virtue and the circle of life. Orochi is the exception here, as she has not created any creatures in her own image. She has, however, created serpentine creatures to help her rid the Orient of undead.

entries.name: Serafs of Genbu
entries: Eons ago Genbu created dozens of great turtles to act on his behalf, healing and protecting the weak. He hasn't been able to create more Serafs for millennia, however, as he is focused solely on keeping the Shadowlands in check, ensuring they don't spread any further.

entries.name: Great Turtle
entries: The great turtles are benevolent and kind, though only a few remain to this day. Most of them swim deep beneath the waves, conversing with Genbu telling tales of kindness and heroic deeds from the lands above, motivating Genbu to continue his eternal struggle. They look exactly like dragon turtles, though both their claws, scales, and shell are black.
It is widely believed that dragon turtles, and in fact all turtles and tortoises, are descendant from the Great Turtles.

entries.name: Immortal Nature
entries: A great turtle doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Kamic Turtle
entries: The kamic turtle is a giant turtle that is descended directly from the great turtles. Contrary to most of its cousins, however, the kamic turtle has retained some magical potency along with a keen intellect. They often act as the agents of Great Turtles, who prefer not to be seen.
Only a select few mortals ever encounter a kamic turtle, and even seeing one is considered a great blessing.
They look like giant turtles, their color varying between shades of black, brown, gray, and green.

trait.name: Clash (1/Turn)
entries: The samurai deals an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) force damage with a successful attack.

trait.name: Grace
entries: The samurai cannot suffer from disadvantage when attacking with its nodachi.

trait.name: Weapon Bond
entries: The samurai can summon its weapon into its hand using a bonus action. The samurai can't be disarmed of its weapon unless {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The samurai makes two attacks with its nodachi.

action.name: Nodachi
entries: {@atk mw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hankyu
entries: {@atk rw} +3 to hit, range (80/320), one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

Samurai are the noble warriors of the Orient. The samurai statblock shows a regular samurai, though samurai often differ between clans. If you want to flavor a samurai from a particular clan, add the statistics from one of the clans below to the samurai statblock.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Nature +3, Performance +4

entries.name: Ckickadee Cunning
entries: The samurai has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

entries.name: AC
entries: 17 (lamellar)

entries.name: Skills
entries: Perception +3, Survival +3

entries.name: Senses
entries: passive Perception 13

entries.name: Crawdad Stance
entries: The samurai's AC increases by 1. In addition, the samurai can neither be knocked prone nor critically hit.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Deception +4

entries.name: Master of Disguises
entries: The samurai has a disguise kit and gains a +8 bonus when attempting to disguise itself.

entries.name: Speed
entries: 50 ft.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Insight +3, Persuasion +4

entries.name: Heron Stance
entries: The samurai can take the Dash or Dodge actions as a bonus action.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Animal Handling +3, Persuasion +4

entries.name: Born Rider
entries: The samurai has advantage on checks to remain mounted.

entries.name: Pegasus Stance
entries: While mounted, the samurai's mount has its speed increased by 30 ft. and attacks against the samurai or its mount are made with disadvantage.

entries.name: Damage Resistances
entries: fire, lightning, psychic, thunder

entries.name: Skills
entries: Arcana +2, Religion +3

entries.name: Phoenix Resilience
entries: The samurai has advantage on saving throws against being charmed.

entries.name: Phoenix Stance
entries: When the samurai is reduced to 0 hit points, it can make a Constitution saving throw (DC 5 + damage taken). On a success, the samurai drops to 1 hit point instead. The samurai cannot attempt a Constitution saving throw if it is reduced to 0 hit points by a critical hit or by necrotic damage.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Medicine +3, Nature +3

entries.name: Forest Born
entries: Difficult terrain caused by plants doesn't slow the samurai's movement.

entries.name: Small Build
entries: The samurai counts as one size smaller for the purpose of determining cover.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Animal Handling +3

entries.name: Speak with Rhinoceroses
entries: Through sounds and gestures, the samurai can communicate simple ideas with rhinos.

entries.name: Tool and Kit Proficiency
entries: The samurai has both smith's tools and a climber's kit. The samurai gains a +4 bonus when using them.

entries.name: Extra Proficiencies
entries: The samurai has a set of Navigator's Tools. Additionally, the samurai gains a +4 bonus when using the tools and when commandeering Vehicles (water).

entries.name: Heightened Senses
entries: The samurai has advantage on a Dexterity saving throws.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Acrobatics +3, Stealth +5

entries.name: Spider Stance
entries: The samurai can deal an additional 5 (1d10) force damage on its first successful attack on its turn.

entries.name: Swamp Lander
entries: Difficult terrain caused by swamps doesn't slow the samurai's movement. Additionally, the samurai has advantage on saving throws against wilderness hazards such as quicksand and razorvine.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Intimidation +4, History +3

entries.name: Tiger Endurance
entries: Any damage the samurai takes is reduced by 2.

entries.name: Tiger Stance
entries: The samurai and its allies within 10 feet of it gain 2 temporary hit points at the end of each of the samurai's turns. Additionally, the samurai and its allies within 10 feet of it, can add 2 to their first attack roll each turn.

entries.name: Speak with Tigers
entries: Through sounds and gestures, the samurai can communicate simple ideas with tigers.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Insight +3

entries.name: Master of Disguises
entries: The samurai has a disguise kit and gains a +8 bonus when attempting to disguise itself.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Perception +3, Performance +4

entries.name: Senses passive
entries: Perception 13

entries.name: Mask of the Wild
entries: The samurai can attempt to hide when lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries.name: Musician
entries: The samurai has an instrument and gains a +4 bonus when playing it.

entries.name: Speed
entries: 35 ft.

entries.name: Skills
entries: Athletics +6, Nature +3

entries.name: Condition Immunities
entries: frightened

entries.name: Skills
entries: Insight +3, Perception +3

entries.name: Senses
entries: passive Perception 13

entries.name: Climber's Kit Proficiency
entries: The samurai has a climber's kit and gains a +4 bonus when using it.

entries.name: Mountain Born
entries: The samurai is naturally adapted to cold climates and is acclimated to high altitudes, including elevations above 20,000 feet.

entries.name: Wyvern Stance
entries: Attacks against the samurai cannot be made with advantage.
